dim_contracts.name: dim_contracts
dim_contracts.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACTS (
	ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The unique Ethereum address of the deployed contract.', CONTRACT_METADATA
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'This JSON column contains other relevant details for each contract.', CREATED_BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number when the contract was created', CREATED_BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp when the contract was created', CREATED_TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash when the contract was created', CREATOR_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the creator of the contract', DECIMALS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.', DIM_CONTRACTS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the deployed contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.', SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.'
)
dim_contracts.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACTS(
	ADDRESS COMMENT 'The unique Ethereum address of the deployed contract.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.',
	NAME COMMENT 'The name of the deployed contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.',
	CONTRACT_METADATA COMMENT 'This JSON column contains other relevant details for each contract.',
	CREATED_BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number when the contract was created',
	CREATED_BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp when the contract was created',
	CREATED_TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash when the contract was created',
	CREATOR_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the creator of the contract',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACTS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains all the contracts that are deployed on the Ethereum blockchain along with their on-chain metadata.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    c0.created_contract_address AS address,
    c1.symbol AS symbol,
    c1.name AS NAME,
    c1.decimals AS decimals,
    c1.contract_metadata AS contract_metadata,
    c0.block_number AS created_block_number,
    c0.block_timestamp AS created_block_timestamp,
    c0.tx_hash AS created_tx_hash,
    c0.creator_address AS creator_address,
    COALESCE (
        c0.created_contracts_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(c0.created_contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS dim_contracts_id,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(c0.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c1.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS inserted_timestamp,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(c0.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c1.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.created_contracts
    c0
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver.contracts
    c1
    ON LOWER(
        c0.created_contract_address
    ) = LOWER(
        c1.address
    )
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.1", "dbt_version": "1.4.9", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "8a6a4967-f11b-469c-bbc7-679980390918", "node_name": "core__dim_contracts", "node_alias": "dim_contracts", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/core/core__dim_contracts.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "core", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.core__dim_contracts", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": false, "which": "run", "node_refs": ["silver__created_contracts", "silver__contracts"], "materialized": "view"} */;

ez_token_transfers.name: ez_token_transfers
ez_token_transfers.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_TOKEN_TRANSFERS (
	AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal transformed amount for this token. Tokens without a decimal adjustment will be nulled out here.', AMOUNT_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The decimal transformed amount for this token returned as a string to preserve precision. Tokens without a decimal adjustment will be nulled out here.', AMOUNT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount in US dollars for this transfer at the time of the transfer. Tokens without a decimal adjustment or price will be nulled out here.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Contract address of the token being transferred.', DECIMALS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EZ_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.', HAS_DECIMAL
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'Whether or not our contracts model contains the necessary decimal adjustment for this token.', HAS_PRICE
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'Whether or not our prices model contains this hourly token price.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', RAW_AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.', RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred returned as a string to preserve precision. This value is not decimal adjusted.', SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.', TOKEN_PRICE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The price, if available, for this token at the transfer time.', TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.', _INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_LTZ(3)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.'', _LOG_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''
)
ez_token_transfers.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_TOKEN_TRANSFERS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'Contract address of the token being transferred.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.',
	RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred returned as a string to preserve precision. This value is not decimal adjusted.',
	RAW_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.',
	AMOUNT_PRECISE COMMENT 'The decimal transformed amount for this token returned as a string to preserve precision. Tokens without a decimal adjustment will be nulled out here.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'The decimal transformed amount for this token. Tokens without a decimal adjustment will be nulled out here.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The amount in US dollars for this transfer at the time of the transfer. Tokens without a decimal adjustment or price will be nulled out here.',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The number of decimal places this contract needs adjusted where token values exist. For example, use the decimal field to correctly transform raw amounts in ```fact_token_transfers```.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol used to represent this contract. Please note this is not necessarily unique.',
	TOKEN_PRICE COMMENT 'The price, if available, for this token at the transfer time.',
	HAS_DECIMAL COMMENT 'Whether or not our contracts model contains the necessary decimal adjustment for this token.',
	HAS_PRICE COMMENT 'Whether or not our prices model contains this hourly token price.',
	_LOG_ID COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	_INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table will contain all events in the ```fact_token_transfers table```, along with joined columns such as token price, symbol, and decimals where possible that allow for easier analysis of token transfer events. Please note Native ETH transfers are not included here.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    contract_address,
    from_address,
    to_address,
    raw_amount_precise,
    raw_amount,
    amount_precise,
    amount,
    amount_usd,
    decimals,
    symbol,
    token_price,
    has_decimal,
    has_price,
    _log_id,
    _inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE (
        transfers_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_token_transfers_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.transfers
  )

fact_transactions.name: fact_transactions
fact_transactions.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRANSACTIONS (
	BLOB_GAS_PRICE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The price of blob gas in wei.', BLOB_GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The total amount of blob gas consumed by transactions in the block.', BLOB_VERSIONED_HASHES
	ARRAY
	COMMENT 'A list of hashed outputs from kzg_to_versioned_hash.', BLOCK_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Block hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generate when a block is produced.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CHAIN_ID
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The chain ID of the transaction.', CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.', EFFECTIVE_GAS_PRICE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The effective gas price of the transaction, in wei.', FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this transaction.', GAS_LIMIT
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction.', GAS_PRICE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'Cost per unit of gas in Gwei.', GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Gas used by transaction.', INPUT_DATA
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'This column contains additional data for this transaction, and is commonly used as part of a contract interaction or as a message to the recipient.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MAX_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The maximum fee a user is willing to pay per blob gas.', MAX_FEE_PER_GAS
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The maximum fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.', MAX_PRIORITY_FEE_PER_GAS
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The maximum priority fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NONCE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The number of transactions sent from a given address.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of the contract call.', POSITION
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The position of the transaction within the block.', R
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The r value of the transaction signature.', S
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The s value of the transaction signature.', STATUS
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.', TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transaction. This can be a contract address.', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'Amount paid to validate the transaction in Ether.', TX_FEE_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216), TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.', TX_TYPE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The type of the transaction, 2 for EIP-1559 transactions and 0 for legacy transactions.', V
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The v value of the transaction signature.', VALUE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The value transacted in Ether.', VALUE_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.', VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.'
)
fact_transactions.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRANSACTIONS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	BLOCK_HASH COMMENT 'Block hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generate when a block is produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.',
	NONCE COMMENT 'The number of transactions sent from a given address.',
	POSITION COMMENT 'The position of the transaction within the block.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of the contract call.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this transaction.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transaction. This can be a contract address.',
	VALUE COMMENT 'The value transacted in Ether.',
	VALUE_PRECISE_RAW COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	VALUE_PRECISE COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'Amount paid to validate the transaction in Ether.',
	TX_FEE_PRECISE,
	GAS_PRICE COMMENT 'Cost per unit of gas in Gwei.',
	GAS_LIMIT COMMENT 'Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction.',
	GAS_USED COMMENT 'Gas used by transaction.',
	CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED COMMENT 'The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.',
	INPUT_DATA COMMENT 'This column contains additional data for this transaction, and is commonly used as part of a contract interaction or as a message to the recipient.',
	STATUS COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.',
	EFFECTIVE_GAS_PRICE COMMENT 'The effective gas price of the transaction, in wei.',
	MAX_FEE_PER_GAS COMMENT 'The maximum fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.',
	MAX_PRIORITY_FEE_PER_GAS COMMENT 'The maximum priority fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.',
	R COMMENT 'The r value of the transaction signature.',
	S COMMENT 'The s value of the transaction signature.',
	V COMMENT 'The v value of the transaction signature.',
	TX_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of the transaction, 2 for EIP-1559 transactions and 0 for legacy transactions.',
	CHAIN_ID COMMENT 'The chain ID of the transaction.',
	BLOB_VERSIONED_HASHES COMMENT 'A list of hashed outputs from kzg_to_versioned_hash.',
	MAX_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS COMMENT 'The maximum fee a user is willing to pay per blob gas.',
	BLOB_GAS_USED COMMENT 'The total amount of blob gas consumed by transactions in the block.',
	BLOB_GAS_PRICE COMMENT 'The price of blob gas in wei.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains transaction level data for the Ethereum Blockchain. Each transaction will have a unique transaction hash, along with transactions fees and an ETH value transferred when applicable. Transactions may be native ETH transfers or interactions with contract addresses. For more information, please see [The Ethereum Organization - Transactions](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/transactions/)'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    block_hash,
    tx_hash,
    nonce,
    POSITION,
    origin_function_signature,
    from_address,
    to_address,
    VALUE,
    value_precise_raw,
    value_precise,
    tx_fee,
    tx_fee_precise,
    gas_price,
    gas AS gas_limit,
    gas_used,
    cumulative_gas_used,
    input_data,
    tx_status AS status,
    effective_gas_price,
    max_fee_per_gas,
    max_priority_fee_per_gas,
    r,
    s,
    v,
    tx_type,
    chain_id,
    blob_versioned_hashes,
    max_fee_per_blob_gas,
    blob_gas_used,
    blob_gas_price,
    COALESCE (
        transactions_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_transactions_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.transactions
  )

dim_event_signatures.name: dim_event_signatures
dim_event_signatures.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_EVENT_SIGNATURES (
	DIM_EVENT_SIGNATURES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', HEX_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The hex signature for this event.', ID
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The ID for this function or event signature.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', TEXT_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The human-readable format for this function or event.', _INVOCATION_ID
	VARCHAR(36)
)
dim_event_signatures.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_EVENT_SIGNATURES(
	TEXT_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The human-readable format for this function or event.',
	HEX_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The hex signature for this event.',
	ID COMMENT 'The ID for this function or event signature.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_EVENT_SIGNATURES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	_INVOCATION_ID
) COMMENT='This table contains event signatures used to decode Ethereum event data into a human-readable format. For more details see (https://www.4byte.directory/).'
 as (
    

SELECT
    text_signature,
    hex_signature,
    id,
    
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(id as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT)) AS dim_event_signatures_id,
    SYSDATE() AS inserted_timestamp,
    SYSDATE() AS modified_timestamp,
    '0f8476f3-d524-465a-9897-cc72e084d482' AS _invocation_id
FROM
    ethereum.silver.event_signatures_backfill
  )

dim_labels.name: dim_labels
dim_labels.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_LABELS (
	ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Address that the label is for. This is the field that should be used to join other tables with labels.', ADDRESS_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'This table contains labels for addresses on the Ethereum Blockchain.', BLOCKCHAIN
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the blockchain.', CREATOR
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the creator of the label.', DIM_LABELS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', LABEL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The label for this address.', LABEL_SUBTYPE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'A sub-category nested within label type providing further detail.', LABEL_TYPE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'A high-level category describing the addresses main function or ownership.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
)
dim_labels.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_LABELS(
	BLOCKCHAIN COMMENT 'The name of the blockchain.',
	CREATOR COMMENT 'The name of the creator of the label.',
	ADDRESS COMMENT 'Address that the label is for. This is the field that should be used to join other tables with labels.',
	ADDRESS_NAME COMMENT 'This table contains labels for addresses on the Ethereum Blockchain.',
	LABEL_TYPE COMMENT 'A high-level category describing the addresses main function or ownership.',
	LABEL_SUBTYPE COMMENT 'A sub-category nested within label type providing further detail.',
	LABEL COMMENT 'The label for this address.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_LABELS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='The labels table is a store of one-to-one address identifiers, or an address name. Labels are broken out into a \"type\" (such as cex, dex, dapp, games, etc.) and a \"subtype\" (ex: contract_deployer, hot_wallet, token_contract, etc.) in order to help classify each address name into similar groups. Our labels are sourced from many different places, but can primarily be grouped into two categories: automatic and manual. Automatic labels are continuously labeled based on certain criteria, such as a known contract deploying another contract, behavior based algorithms for finding deposit wallets, and consistent data pulls of custom protocol APIs. Manual labels are done periodically to find addresses that cannot be found programmatically such as finding new protocol addresses, centralized exchange hot wallets, or trending addresses. Labels can also be added by our community by using our add-a-label tool (https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/add-a-label/) or on-chain with near (https://near.social/lord1.near/widget/Form) and are reviewed by our labels team. A label can be removed by our labels team if it is found to be incorrect or no longer relevant; this generally will only happen for mislabeled deposit wallets.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    blockchain,
    creator,
    address,
    address_name,
    label_type,
    label_subtype,
    project_name AS label,
    labels_combined_id AS dim_labels_id,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.labels
  )

fact_contract_reads.name: fact_contract_reads
fact_contract_reads.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_CONTRACT_READS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number the contract address was read at.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the contract read.', FACT_CONTRACT_READS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FUNCTION_INPUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function inputs called in this read, if applicable.', FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature called by this read. See `dim_function_signatures` for text versions.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', READ_OUTPUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The return of the contract call.', SEGMENTED_OUTPUT
	ARRAY
	COMMENT 'The return of the contract call, segmented into 64 character strings.'
)
fact_contract_reads.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_CONTRACT_READS(
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the contract read.',
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number the contract address was read at.',
	FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature called by this read. See `dim_function_signatures` for text versions.',
	FUNCTION_INPUT COMMENT 'The function inputs called in this read, if applicable.',
	READ_OUTPUT COMMENT 'The return of the contract call.',
	SEGMENTED_OUTPUT COMMENT 'The return of the contract call, segmented into 64 character strings.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_CONTRACT_READS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains contract reads for a variety of functions and contracts on the Ethereum Blockchain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    contract_address,
    block_number,
    function_signature,
    function_input,
    read_output,
    segmented_data AS segmented_output,
    COALESCE (
        reads_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(function_signature as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(function_input as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_contract_reads_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.reads
  )

fact_token_balances.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_BALANCES (
	BALANCE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The unadjusted token balance.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Block number at which the token balance was read.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'Timestamp of block number read.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the token.', FACT_TOKEN_BALANCES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', USER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Wallet / contract address holding tokens.'
)
fact_token_balances.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_BALANCES(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Block number at which the token balance was read.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Timestamp of block number read.',
	USER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'Wallet / contract address holding tokens.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the token.',
	BALANCE COMMENT 'The unadjusted token balance.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_BALANCES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='BALANCES')
 COMMENT='''This table contains the unadjusted token balances for users on the Ethereum blockchain.  When a token transfer event occurs, we will read the balance of the involved parties at the transfer block.  Please see `ethereum.core.dim_contracts` for decimal adjustments. Includes both ERC20s and ERC721s.''\n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    address AS user_address,
    contract_address,
    balance,
    COALESCE (
        token_balances_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_token_balances_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.token_balances
  )

dim_contract_abis.name: dim_contract_abis
dim_contract_abis.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACT_ABIS (
	ABI
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'The JSON ABI for the contract.', ABI_SOURCE
	VARCHAR(16)
	COMMENT 'The source of the ABI. This can be `etherscan`, `user_submitted`, or `bytecode_matched`.', BYTECODE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The deployed bytecode of the contract.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the contract.', DIM_CONTRACT_ABIS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
)
dim_contract_abis.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACT_ABIS(
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the contract.',
	ABI COMMENT 'The JSON ABI for the contract.',
	ABI_SOURCE COMMENT 'The source of the ABI. This can be `etherscan`, `user_submitted`, or `bytecode_matched`.',
	BYTECODE COMMENT 'The deployed bytecode of the contract.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_CONTRACT_ABIS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='''This table contains the contract ABIs that we have sourced from Etherscan, the community, or bytecode matched. This table is the source of ABIs used in the `core__ez_decoded_event_logs` and `core__fact_decoded_event_logs` tables. We first try to source ABIs from Etherscan. If we cannot find an ABI on Etherscan, we will rely on user submissions. To add a contract to this table, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/). If we are unable to locate an ABI for a contract from Etherscan or the community, we will try to find an ABI to use by matching the contract bytecode to a known contract bytecode we do have an ABI for.'' \n \n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    contract_address,
    DATA AS abi,
    abi_source,
    bytecode,
    COALESCE (
        abis_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS dim_contract_abis_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.abis
  )

ez_decoded_event_logs.name: ez_decoded_event_logs
ez_decoded_event_logs.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.', CONTRACT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the contract, if the contract has a name() function.', DATA
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The un-decoded event data.', DECODED_LOG
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.', EVENT_REMOVED
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.', EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FULL_DECODED_LOG
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', TOPICS
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'The un-decoded event input topics.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.', TX_STATUS
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.'
)
ez_decoded_event_logs.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	CONTRACT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the contract, if the contract has a name() function.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.',
	DECODED_LOG COMMENT 'The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.',
	FULL_DECODED_LOG COMMENT 'The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	TOPICS COMMENT 'The un-decoded event input topics.',
	DATA COMMENT 'The un-decoded event data.',
	EVENT_REMOVED COMMENT 'Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.',
	TX_STATUS COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='''For information on how to submit a contract for decoding, as well as how ABIs are sourced, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/). This model contains decoded event logs for contracts that we have an ABI for. Please note, this table does not include all event logs, only those that we have an ABI for. The `decoded_log` column is the easiest place to query decoded data. It is a JSON object, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters. You can select from this column using the following sample format, `decoded_log:from::string` or more generally, `decoded_log:<event_param>::datatype`. See below for a full sample query. The `full_decoded_logs` column contains the same information, as well as additional fields such as the datatype of the decoded data. You may need to laterally flatten this column to query the data.\n      \nSample query for USDC Transfer events:\n```sql select  tx_hash, block_number, contract_address, decoded_log:from::string as from_address, decoded_log:to::string as to_address, decoded_log:value::integer as value from ethereum.core.fact_decoded_event_logs where contract_address = lower(''0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48'') and block_number between 16400000 and 16405000 and event_name = ''Transfer'' limit 50```''\n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    contract_address,
    C.name AS contract_name,
    event_name,
    decoded_flat AS decoded_log,
    decoded_data AS full_decoded_log,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    topics,
    DATA,
    event_removed,
    tx_status,
    COALESCE (
        decoded_logs_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_decoded_event_logs_id,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(l.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(C.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS inserted_timestamp,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(l.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(C.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.decoded_logs
    l
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver.contracts C
    ON l.contract_address = C.address
  )

fact_blocks.name: fact_blocks
fact_blocks.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_BLOCKS (
	BLOB_GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The total amount of blob gas consumed by transactions in the block.', BLOCKCHAIN
	VARCHAR(8)
	COMMENT 'The blockchain on which transactions are being confirmed.', BLOCK_HEADER_JSON
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'This JSON column contains the block header details.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', DIFFICULTY
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The effort required to mine the block.', EXCESS_BLOB_GAS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'A running total of blob gas consumed in excess of the target, prior to the block. This is used to set blob gas pricing.', EXTRA_DATA
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Any data included by the miner for a given block.', FACT_BLOCKS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', GAS_LIMIT
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Total gas limit provided by all transactions in the block.', GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Total gas used in the block.', HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The hash of the block header for a given block.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MINER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Miner who successfully added a given block to the blockchain.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NETWORK
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'The network on the blockchain used by a transaction.', NONCE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Block nonce is a value used during mining to demonstrate proof of work for a given block.', PARENT_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The hash of the block from which a given block is generated. Also known as the parent block.', RECEIPTS_ROOT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The root of the state trie.', SHA3_UNCLES
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The mechanism which Ethereum Javascript RLP encodes an empty string.', SIZE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Block size, which is determined by a given block's gas limit.', TOTAL_DIFFICULTY
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Total difficulty of the chain at a given block.', TX_COUNT
	NUMBER(9,0)
	COMMENT 'Total number of transactions within a block.', UNCLE_BLOCKS
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'Uncle blocks occur when two blocks are mined and broadcasted at the same time, with the same block number. The block validated across the most nodes will be added to the primary chain, and the other one becomes an uncle block. Miners do receive rewards for uncle blocks.', WITHDRAWALS
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'An array of withdrawals that occurred in this block.', WITHDRAWALS_ROOT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'A hash of the withdrawals that occurred in this block.'
)
fact_blocks.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_BLOCKS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	NETWORK COMMENT 'The network on the blockchain used by a transaction.',
	BLOCKCHAIN COMMENT 'The blockchain on which transactions are being confirmed.',
	TX_COUNT COMMENT 'Total number of transactions within a block.',
	DIFFICULTY COMMENT 'The effort required to mine the block.',
	TOTAL_DIFFICULTY COMMENT 'Total difficulty of the chain at a given block.',
	EXTRA_DATA COMMENT 'Any data included by the miner for a given block.',
	GAS_LIMIT COMMENT 'Total gas limit provided by all transactions in the block.',
	GAS_USED COMMENT 'Total gas used in the block.',
	HASH COMMENT 'The hash of the block header for a given block.',
	PARENT_HASH COMMENT 'The hash of the block from which a given block is generated. Also known as the parent block.',
	MINER COMMENT 'Miner who successfully added a given block to the blockchain.',
	NONCE COMMENT 'Block nonce is a value used during mining to demonstrate proof of work for a given block.',
	RECEIPTS_ROOT COMMENT 'The root of the state trie.',
	SHA3_UNCLES COMMENT 'The mechanism which Ethereum Javascript RLP encodes an empty string.',
	SIZE COMMENT 'Block size, which is determined by a given block''s gas limit.',
	UNCLE_BLOCKS COMMENT 'Uncle blocks occur when two blocks are mined and broadcasted at the same time, with the same block number. The block validated across the most nodes will be added to the primary chain, and the other one becomes an uncle block. Miners do receive rewards for uncle blocks.',
	BLOCK_HEADER_JSON COMMENT 'This JSON column contains the block header details.',
	EXCESS_BLOB_GAS COMMENT 'A running total of blob gas consumed in excess of the target, prior to the block. This is used to set blob gas pricing.',
	BLOB_GAS_USED COMMENT 'The total amount of blob gas consumed by transactions in the block.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_BLOCKS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	WITHDRAWALS COMMENT 'An array of withdrawals that occurred in this block.',
	WITHDRAWALS_ROOT COMMENT 'A hash of the withdrawals that occurred in this block.'
) COMMENT='This table contains block level data for the Ethereum Blockchain. This table can be used to analyze trends at a block level, for example gas fees vs. total transactions over time. For more information, please see [Etherscan Resources](https://etherscan.io/directory/Learning_Resources/Ethereum) or [The Ethereum Organization](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/blocks/)'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    'mainnet' AS network,
    'ethereum' AS blockchain,
    tx_count,
    difficulty,
    total_difficulty,
    extra_data,
    gas_limit,
    gas_used,
    HASH,
    parent_hash,
    miner,
    nonce,
    receipts_root,
    sha3_uncles,
    SIZE,
    uncles AS uncle_blocks,
    OBJECT_CONSTRUCT(
        'baseFeePerGas',
        base_fee_per_gas,
        'difficulty',
        difficulty,
        'extraData',
        extra_data,
        'gasLimit',
        gas_limit,
        'gasUsed',
        gas_used,
        'hash',
        HASH,
        'logsBloom',
        logs_bloom,
        'miner',
        miner,
        'nonce',
        nonce,
        'number',
        NUMBER,
        'parentHash',
        parent_hash,
        'receiptsRoot',
        receipts_root,
        'sha3Uncles',
        sha3_uncles,
        'size',
        SIZE,
        'stateRoot',
        state_root,
        'timestamp',
        block_timestamp,
        'totalDifficulty',
        total_difficulty,
        'transactionsRoot',
        transactions_root,
        'uncles',
        uncles,
        'excessBlobGas',
        excess_blob_gas,
        'blobGasUsed',
        blob_gas_used
    ) AS block_header_json,
    excess_blob_gas,
    blob_gas_used,
    COALESCE (
        blocks_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_blocks_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp,
    withdrawals,
    withdrawals_root
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.blocks
  )

CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_EVENT_LOGS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.', DATA
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The un-decoded event data.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_REMOVED
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.', FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', TOPICS
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'The un-decoded event input topics.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.', TX_STATUS
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.', _LOG_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''
)
fact_event_logs.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_EVENT_LOGS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	TOPICS COMMENT 'The un-decoded event input topics.',
	DATA COMMENT 'The un-decoded event data.',
	EVENT_REMOVED COMMENT 'Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.',
	TX_STATUS COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.',
	_LOG_ID COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains flattened event logs from transactions on the Ethereum Blockchain. Transactions may have multiple events, which are denoted by the event index for a transaction hash. Therefore, this table is unique on the combination of transaction hash and event index. Please see `fact_decoded_event_logs` or `ez_decoded_event_logs` for the decoded event logs.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    event_index,
    contract_address,
    topics,
    DATA,
    event_removed,
    tx_status,
    _log_id,
    COALESCE (
        logs_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_event_logs_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.logs
  )

ez_balance_deltas.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_BALANCE_DELTAS (
	BAL_DELTA
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted balance change', BAL_DELTA_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted balance change.', BAL_DELTA_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The balance change in USD, will be null for tokens without a decimal.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Block at which the balance was read (when the transfer occurred).', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'Block timestamp at which the balance was read (when the transfer occurred).', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the token (null for ETH).', CURRENT_BAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted token or ETH balance at the current block number.', CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The token or ETH balance at the current block number, without a decimal adjustment.', CURRENT_BAL_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The current balance in USD - this will be null for tokens without a decimal adjustment. Please note, the USD value is calculated at this block.', DECIMALS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The decimals for the token contract.', EZ_BALANCE_DELTAS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', HAS_DECIMAL
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'Whether the token has a decimal or not, either TRUE or FALSE.', HAS_PRICE
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'Whether the token has an hourly price or not, either TRUE or FALSE.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', PREV_BAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted token or ETH balance from the previously recorded record for this wallet and token.', PREV_BAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The token or ETH balance from the previously recorded record for this wallet / token, without a decimal adjustment.', PREV_BAL_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'Previously recorded balance in USD - this will be null for tokens without a decimal adjustment. Please note, the USD value is calculated at this block.', SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token contract, or ETH.', TOKEN_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the token contract, or Native ETH.', USER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The wallet address holding the tokens / ETH.'
)
ez_balance_deltas.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_BALANCE_DELTAS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Block at which the balance was read (when the transfer occurred).',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Block timestamp at which the balance was read (when the transfer occurred).',
	USER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The wallet address holding the tokens / ETH.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the token (null for ETH).',
	PREV_BAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The token or ETH balance from the previously recorded record for this wallet / token, without a decimal adjustment.',
	PREV_BAL COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted token or ETH balance from the previously recorded record for this wallet and token.',
	PREV_BAL_USD COMMENT 'Previously recorded balance in USD - this will be null for tokens without a decimal adjustment. Please note, the USD value is calculated at this block.',
	CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The token or ETH balance at the current block number, without a decimal adjustment.',
	CURRENT_BAL COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted token or ETH balance at the current block number.',
	CURRENT_BAL_USD COMMENT 'The current balance in USD - this will be null for tokens without a decimal adjustment. Please note, the USD value is calculated at this block.',
	BAL_DELTA_UNADJ COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted balance change.',
	BAL_DELTA COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted balance change',
	BAL_DELTA_USD COMMENT 'The balance change in USD, will be null for tokens without a decimal.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token contract, or ETH.',
	TOKEN_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the token contract, or Native ETH.',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The decimals for the token contract.',
	HAS_DECIMAL COMMENT 'Whether the token has a decimal or not, either TRUE or FALSE.',
	HAS_PRICE COMMENT 'Whether the token has an hourly price or not, either TRUE or FALSE.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_BALANCE_DELTAS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='BALANCES')
 COMMENT='This table contains the block level balance changes for both tokens (including ERC721s) and Native ETH on the Ethereum Blockchain for all wallets and contracts. If a token or Native ETH is moved, we will read the balance of the involved wallets at that block, and carry forward the previous balance into the current record. Symbol, name, and price are joined where possible. ERC721s are included. Data is currently read at the max daily block for wallets with activity. We plan to increase the granularity on this table to block level changes in the near term. \n\nPlease note - the underlying data for this is large. If you want your query to run quickly, please use filters as much as possible. Using at least `block_timestamp::date` as a filter will lead to optimal query performance.\n\nIf you want to take this data and make it daily, you can do so with the query below. You must use a `block_timestamp::date` filter here at a minimum. Other filters will help query runtime. \n\n```sql\nWITH base_table AS (\n    SELECT\n        block_timestamp :: DATE AS balance_date,\n        CASE\n            WHEN symbol = ''ETH'' THEN ''ETH''\n            ELSE contract_address\n        END AS contract_address,\n        user_address,\n        symbol,\n        current_bal\n    FROM\n        ethereum.core.ez_balance_diffs\n    WHERE\n        block_timestamp :: DATE >= '''' --user input \n        AND user_address = '''' --user input\n        AND (\n            contract_address = '''' --user input\n            OR symbol = ''ETH''\n        )\n),\nall_days AS (\n    SELECT\n        date_day AS balance_date\n    FROM\n        ethereum.core.dim_dates\n),\naddress_ranges AS (\n    SELECT\n        user_address,\n        contract_address,\n        symbol,\n        MIN(\n            balance_date :: DATE\n        ) AS min_block_date,\n        CURRENT_DATE() :: DATE AS max_block_date\n    FROM\n        base_table\n    GROUP BY\n        user_address,\n        contract_address,\n        symbol,\n        max_block_date\n),\nall_dates AS (\n    SELECT\n        C.balance_date,\n        A.user_address,\n        A.contract_address,\n        A.symbol\n    FROM\n        all_days C\n        LEFT JOIN address_ranges A\n        ON C.full_balance_date BETWEEN A.min_block_date\n        AND A.max_block_date\n    WHERE\n        A.user_address IS NOT NULL\n),\neth_balances AS (\n    SELECT\n        user_address,\n        contract_address,\n        balance_date,\n        current_bal,\n        TRUE AS daily_activity\n    FROM\n        base_table\n),\nbalance_tmp AS (\n    SELECT\n        d.balance_date,\n        d.user_address,\n        d.contract_address,\n        d.symbol,\n        b.current_bal,\n        b.daily_activity\n    FROM\n        all_dates d\n        LEFT JOIN eth_balances b\n        ON d.balance_date = b.balance_date\n        AND d.user_address = b.user_address\n        AND d.contract_address = b.contract_address\n),\nFINAL AS (\n    SELECT\n        balance_date,\n        user_address,\n        contract_address,\n        symbol,\n        LAST_VALUE(\n            current_bal ignore nulls\n        ) over(\n            PARTITION BY user_address,\n            contract_address\n            ORDER BY\n                balance_date ASC rows unbounded preceding\n        ) AS balance,\n        CASE\n            WHEN daily_activity IS NULL THEN FALSE\n            ELSE TRUE\n        END AS daily_activity\n    FROM\n        balance_tmp\n)\nSELECT\n    *\nFROM\n    FINAL\nWHERE\n    balance <> 0\nORDER BY\n    balance_date DESC,\n    contract_address\n```'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    eb.address AS user_address,
    NULL AS contract_address,
    prev_bal_unadj,
    prev_bal_unadj / pow(
        10,
        18
    ) AS prev_bal,
    ROUND(
        prev_bal * ep.price,
        2
    ) AS prev_bal_usd,
    current_bal_unadj,
    current_bal_unadj / pow(
        10,
        18
    ) AS current_bal,
    ROUND(
        current_bal * ep.price,
        2
    ) AS current_bal_usd,
    current_bal_unadj - prev_bal_unadj AS bal_delta_unadj,
    current_bal - prev_bal AS bal_delta,
    current_bal_usd - prev_bal_usd AS bal_delta_usd,
    'ETH' AS symbol,
    'Native Ether' AS token_name,
    18 AS decimals,
    TRUE AS has_decimal,
    ep.price IS NOT NULL AS has_price,
    COALESCE (
        eth_balance_diffs_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_balance_deltas_id,
    GREATEST(
        COALESCE(
            eb.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            ep.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        )
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    GREATEST(
        COALESCE(
            eb.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            ep.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        )
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.eth_balance_diffs
    eb
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.price.ez_prices_hourly
    ep
    ON DATE_TRUNC(
        'hour',
        eb.block_timestamp
    ) = ep.hour
    AND ep.token_address = '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2'
UNION ALL
SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tb.address AS user_address,
    contract_address,
    prev_bal_unadj,
    CASE
        WHEN C.decimals IS NOT NULL THEN prev_bal_unadj / pow(
            10,
            C.decimals
        )
    END AS prev_bal,
    CASE
        WHEN C.decimals IS NOT NULL THEN ROUND(
            prev_bal * tp.price,
            2
        )
    END AS prev_bal_usd,
    current_bal_unadj,
    CASE
        WHEN C.decimals IS NOT NULL THEN current_bal_unadj / pow(
            10,
            C.decimals
        )
    END AS current_bal,
    CASE
        WHEN C.decimals IS NOT NULL THEN ROUND(
            current_bal * tp.price,
            2
        )
    END AS current_bal_usd,
    current_bal_unadj - prev_bal_unadj AS bal_delta_unadj,
    current_bal - prev_bal AS bal_delta,
    current_bal_usd - prev_bal_usd AS bal_delta_usd,
    C.symbol AS symbol,
    C.name AS token_name,
    C.decimals AS decimals,
    C.decimals IS NOT NULL AS has_decimal,
    tp.price IS NOT NULL AS has_price,
    COALESCE (
        token_balance_diffs_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tb.block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(tb.contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(tb.address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_balance_deltas_id,
    GREATEST(
        COALESCE(
            tb.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            tp.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            C.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        )
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    GREATEST(
        COALESCE(
            tb.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            tp.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ),
        COALESCE(
            C.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        )
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.token_balance_diffs
    tb
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.price.ez_prices_hourly
    tp
    ON DATE_TRUNC(
        'hour',
        tb.block_timestamp
    ) = tp.hour
    AND tp.token_address = tb.contract_address
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver.contracts C
    ON tb.contract_address = LOWER(
        C.address
    )
  )

ez_current_balances.name: ez_current_balances
ez_current_balances.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES (
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the token (null for ETH).', CURRENT_BAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted current token or ETH balance.', CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The current token or ETH balance for this address, without a decimal adjustment.', DECIMALS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The decimals for the token contract.', EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', HAS_DECIMAL
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'Whether the token has a decimal or not, either TRUE or FALSE.', HAS_PRICE
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'Whether the token has an hourly price or not, either TRUE or FALSE.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The last block where this token was transferred by this address.', LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9), LAST_RECORDED_PRICE
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of the last hourly price recorded for this token.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token contract, or ETH.', TOKEN_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the token contract, or Native ETH.', USD_VALUE_LAST_ACTIVITY
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, at the time the last token activity occurred. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.', USD_VALUE_NOW
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, as of the most recently recorded hourly price. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.', USER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The wallet address holding the tokens / ETH.'
)
ez_current_balances.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES(
	LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK COMMENT 'The last block where this token was transferred by this address.',
	LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK_TIMESTAMP,
	USER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The wallet address holding the tokens / ETH.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the token (null for ETH).',
	CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The current token or ETH balance for this address, without a decimal adjustment.',
	CURRENT_BAL COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted current token or ETH balance.',
	USD_VALUE_LAST_ACTIVITY COMMENT 'The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, at the time the last token activity occurred. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.',
	USD_VALUE_NOW COMMENT 'The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, as of the most recently recorded hourly price. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token contract, or ETH.',
	TOKEN_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the token contract, or Native ETH.',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The decimals for the token contract.',
	HAS_DECIMAL COMMENT 'Whether the token has a decimal or not, either TRUE or FALSE.',
	HAS_PRICE COMMENT 'Whether the token has an hourly price or not, either TRUE or FALSE.',
	LAST_RECORDED_PRICE COMMENT 'The timestamp of the last hourly price recorded for this token.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='BALANCES')
 COMMENT='This table contains the current, non 0, balances for wallets on the Ethereum Blockchain. Symbol, name, and price are joined where possible. Prices are calculated as of the last activity date and as of the most recently recorded hourly price. ERC721s are included.\n\nPlease note - the underlying data for this is large. If you want your query to run quickly, please use filters as much as possible. Using at least `last_activity_block_timestamp::date` as a filter will lead to optimal query performance.'
 as (
    

WITH prices AS (

    SELECT
        HOUR,
        LOWER(token_address) AS token_address,
        price,
        inserted_timestamp,
        modified_timestamp
    FROM
        ETHEREUM.price.ez_prices_hourly
    WHERE
        price IS NOT NULL
        AND token_address IS NOT NULL
),
token_metadata AS (
    SELECT
        LOWER(address) AS token_address,
        symbol,
        NAME,
        decimals,
        inserted_timestamp,
        modified_timestamp
    FROM
        ETHEREUM.silver.contracts
),
last_price AS (
    SELECT
        HOUR,
        token_address,
        price,
        inserted_timestamp,
        modified_timestamp
    FROM
        prices qualify(ROW_NUMBER() over (PARTITION BY token_address
    ORDER BY
        HOUR DESC)) = 1
),
latest_tokens AS (
    SELECT
        block_number,
        block_timestamp,
        address,
        contract_address,
        current_bal_unadj,
        token_balance_diffs_id,
        inserted_timestamp,
        modified_timestamp
    FROM
        ETHEREUM.silver.token_balance_diffs
        qualify(ROW_NUMBER() over (PARTITION BY address, contract_address
    ORDER BY
        block_number DESC)) = 1
),
latest_eth AS (
    SELECT
        block_number,
        block_timestamp,
        address,
        NULL AS contract_address,
        current_bal_unadj,
        eth_balance_diffs_id,
        inserted_timestamp,
        modified_timestamp
    FROM
        ETHEREUM.silver.eth_balance_diffs
        qualify(ROW_NUMBER() over (PARTITION BY address
    ORDER BY
        block_number DESC)) = 1
),
token_diffs AS (
    SELECT
        block_number,
        block_timestamp,
        address,
        contract_address,
        current_bal_unadj,
        CASE
            WHEN decimals IS NOT NULL THEN current_bal_unadj / pow(
                10,
                decimals
            )
        END AS current_bal,
        CASE
            WHEN decimals IS NOT NULL THEN ROUND(
                current_bal * A.price,
                2
            )
        END AS usd_value_last_activity,
        CASE
            WHEN decimals IS NOT NULL THEN ROUND(
                current_bal * b.price,
                2
            )
        END AS usd_value_now,
        symbol,
        NAME,
        decimals,
        CASE
            WHEN decimals IS NULL THEN FALSE
            ELSE TRUE
        END AS has_decimal,
        CASE
            WHEN A.price IS NULL THEN FALSE
            ELSE TRUE
        END AS has_price,
        b.hour :: TIMESTAMP AS last_recorded_price,
        COALESCE(
            base.token_balance_diffs_id,
            
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(contract_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
        ) AS ez_current_balances_id,
        GREATEST(
            base.inserted_timestamp,
            token_metadata.inserted_timestamp,
            A.inserted_timestamp,
            b.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ) AS inserted_timestamp,
        GREATEST(
            base.modified_timestamp,
            token_metadata.modified_timestamp,
            A.modified_timestamp,
            b.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ) AS modified_timestamp
    FROM
        latest_tokens base
        LEFT JOIN token_metadata
        ON base.contract_address = token_metadata.token_address
        LEFT JOIN prices A
        ON DATE_TRUNC(
            'hour',
            block_timestamp
        ) = A.hour
        AND A.token_address = base.contract_address
        LEFT JOIN last_price b
        ON b.token_address = base.contract_address
    WHERE
        current_bal_unadj <> 0
),
eth_diffs AS (
    SELECT
        block_number,
        block_timestamp,
        address,
        contract_address,
        current_bal_unadj,
        current_bal_unadj / pow(
            10,
            18
        ) AS current_bal,
        ROUND(
            current_bal * A.price,
            2
        ) AS usd_value_last_activity,
        ROUND(
            current_bal * b.price,
            2
        ) AS usd_value_now,
        'ETH' AS symbol,
        'Native Ether' AS NAME,
        18 AS decimals,
        TRUE AS has_decimal,
        CASE
            WHEN A.price IS NULL THEN FALSE
            ELSE TRUE
        END AS has_price,
        b.hour :: TIMESTAMP AS last_recorded_price,
        COALESCE(
            eth_balance_diffs_id,
            
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
        ) AS ez_current_balances_id,
        GREATEST(
            latest_eth.inserted_timestamp,
            A.inserted_timestamp,
            b.inserted_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ) AS inserted_timestamp,
        GREATEST(
            latest_eth.modified_timestamp,
            A.modified_timestamp,
            b.modified_timestamp,
            '2000-01-01'
        ) AS modified_timestamp
    FROM
        latest_eth
        LEFT JOIN prices A
        ON DATE_TRUNC(
            'hour',
            block_timestamp
        ) = A.hour
        AND A.token_address = '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2'
        LEFT JOIN last_price b
        ON b.token_address = '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2'
    WHERE
        current_bal_unadj <> 0
)
SELECT
    block_number AS last_activity_block,
    block_timestamp AS last_activity_block_timestamp,
    address AS user_address,
    contract_address,
    current_bal_unadj,
    current_bal,
    usd_value_last_activity,
    usd_value_now,
    symbol,
    NAME AS token_name,
    decimals,
    has_decimal,
    has_price,
    last_recorded_price,
    ez_current_balances_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    eth_diffs
UNION ALL
SELECT
    block_number AS last_activity_block,
    block_timestamp AS last_activity_block_timestamp,
    address AS user_address,
    contract_address,
    current_bal_unadj,
    current_bal,
    usd_value_last_activity,
    usd_value_now,
    symbol,
    NAME AS token_name,
    decimals,
    has_decimal,
    has_price,
    last_recorded_price,
    ez_current_balances_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    token_diffs
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.7.15", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "03b6f948-2ea7-4f87-8701-492e3cb44cdc", "node_name": "core__ez_current_balances", "node_alias": "ez_current_balances", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/core/core__ez_current_balances.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "core", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.core__ez_current_balances", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PURPOSE": "BALANCES"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": true, "which": "run", "invocation_command": "dbt run -m models/bronze/prices models/silver/prices models/gold/price models/gold/price/price__ez_prices_hourly.sql+1 --full-refresh", "node_refs": ["price__ez_prices_hourly", "silver__contracts", "silver__token_balance_diffs", "silver__eth_balance_diffs"], "materialized": "view"} */;

ez_snapshot.name: ez_snapshot
ez_snapshot.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_SNAPSHOT (
	CHOICES
	ARRAY
	COMMENT 'An array containing the voting options on the proposal.', DELAY
	NUMBER(38,6)
	COMMENT 'The default number of hours of voting delay for the space. The voting delay is the time between proposal submission and the opening of voting.', ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
