sample_rows:
**Proposed**:

Claim 3,900,000 SWISE from DAO vesting contract 0xF0d99D5d1D5E06CdAd4766503Cb82213B5E1d1bE

Distribute the following SWISE allocations to the pools for 30 days (199385 blocks):

- sETH2/ETH - 3,000,000 SWISE
- sETH2/rETH2 - 400,000 SWISE
- sETH2/SWISE - 500,000 SWISE

Note the amount of proposed rewards is unchanged vs the previous month for the sETH2/ETH and sETH2/SWISE pools. The proposed amount for the sETH2/rETH2 pool has been reduced by 100K SWISE to 400,000 SWISE total.

Vote Yes or No for this proposal.
Authorise the release of Aave <> Chainlink Proof of Reserve for Aave Avalanche

## Summary
This proposal authorises BGD to proceed with the release of Aave <> Chainlink Proof of Reserve Phase 1, targeting Aave v2 & v3 Avalanche.
The repository of the project can be found on [https://github.com/bgd-labs/aave-proof-of-reserve](https://github.com/bgd-labs/aave-proof-of-reserve).


## Context
An extensive explanation on how the system works can be found on [https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-chainlink-proof-of-reserve-phase-1-release-candidate/10972](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-chainlink-proof-of-reserve-phase-1-release-candidate/10972).

Apart from authorising the deployment of the different smart contracts of the system, the Aave community also approves the Aave Guardian to give to these contracts the required protocol's permissions, as described on the project documentation.

The release will be done once the audits reports from the security providers of the community (Certora and SigmaPrime) are completely final.
Will there be a penalty shoot-out?
ez_snapshot.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_SNAPSHOT(
	ID COMMENT 'A pseudo transaction hash assigned to all votes on snapshot.',
	PROPOSAL_ID COMMENT 'An address that identifies the proposal being voted on.',
	VOTER COMMENT 'The wallet address of the user that voted on a proposal.',
	VOTE_OPTION COMMENT 'How the user voted on the proposal. Corresponds to the choices array.',
	VOTING_POWER COMMENT 'The amount of voting power one holds is proportional to the amount of the token they hold.',
	VOTE_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The time at which the vote was cast.',
	CHOICES COMMENT 'An array containing the voting options on the proposal.',
	PROPOSAL_AUTHOR COMMENT 'The address of the wallet that wrote the proposal.',
	PROPOSAL_TITLE COMMENT 'The title or name of the proposal.',
	PROPOSAL_TEXT COMMENT 'The body of the proposal.',
	SPACE_ID COMMENT 'A way to identify which group, or space, on Snapshot a proposal belongs to.',
	NETWORK COMMENT 'The default network or blockchain used for the space.',
	DELAY COMMENT 'The default number of hours of voting delay for the space. The voting delay is the time between proposal submission and the opening of voting.',
	QUORUM COMMENT 'The minimum amount of voting power for a proposal to pass.',
	VOTING_PERIOD COMMENT 'The default time in hours within a space for a proposal to be open for voting.',
	VOTING_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of voting system used for this space. If this column is not null, the same voting system will be used for all proposals in this space.',
	PROPOSAL_START_TIME COMMENT 'The time at which voting on the proposal begins.',
	PROPOSAL_END_TIME COMMENT 'The time at which voting on the proposal ends.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='SNAPSHOT', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='GOVERNANCE')
 COMMENT='A table that contains all votes on Snapshot and information about the voting space and proposal. All data in this table is off chain.'
 as (
    

SELECT 
    id, 
    proposal_id, 
    LOWER(voter) AS voter, 
    vote_option, 
    voting_power, 
    vote_timestamp, 
    choices, 
    LOWER(proposal_author) AS proposal_author, 
    proposal_title, 
    proposal_text, 
    space_id,
    network, 
    delay, 
    quorum, 
    voting_period, 
    voting_type, 
    proposal_start_time, 
    proposal_end_time
FROM 
    ETHEREUM.silver.snapshot
  );

fact_decoded_event_logs.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.', DECODED_LOG
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.', FACT_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FULL_DECODED_LOG
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.'
)
fact_decoded_event_logs.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.',
	DECODED_LOG COMMENT 'The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.',
	FULL_DECODED_LOG COMMENT 'The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='''For information on how to submit a contract for decoding, as well as how ABIs are sourced, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/). This model contains decoded event logs for contracts that we have an ABI for. Please note, this table does not include all event logs, only those that we have an ABI for. This table will perform better than the `core__ez_decoded_event_logs` table, but does not include as many columns.  The `decoded_log` column is the easiest place to query decoded data. It is a JSON object, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters. You can select from this column using the following sample format, `decoded_log:from::string` or more generally, `decoded_log:<event_param>::datatype`. See below for a full sample query. The `full_decoded_logs` column contains the same information, as well as additional fields such as the datatype of the decoded data. You may need to laterally flatten this column to query the data.\nSample query for USDC Transfer events:\n```sql select  tx_hash, block_number, contract_address, decoded_log:from::string as from_address, decoded_log:to::string as to_address, decoded_log:value::integer as value from ethereum.core.fact_decoded_event_logs where contract_address = lower(''0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48'') and block_number between 16400000 and 16405000 and event_name = ''Transfer'' limit 50```''\n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    contract_address,
    event_name,
    decoded_flat AS decoded_log,
    decoded_data AS full_decoded_log,
    COALESCE (
        decoded_logs_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_decoded_event_logs_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.decoded_logs
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.1", "dbt_version": "1.4.9", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "0f8476f3-d524-465a-9897-cc72e084d482", "node_name": "core__fact_decoded_event_logs", "node_alias": "fact_decoded_event_logs", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/core/core__fact_decoded_event_logs.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "core", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.core__fact_decoded_event_logs", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": false, "which": "run", "node_refs": ["silver__decoded_logs"], "materialized": "view"} */;

fact_traces.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRACES (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number of this transaction.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp of this transaction.', DATA
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The raw JSON data for this trace.', ERROR_REASON
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The reason for the trace failure, if any.', FACT_TRACES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.', GAS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The gas supplied for this trace.', GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The gas used for this trace.', IDENTIFIER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.', INPUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The input data for this trace.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', OUTPUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The output data for this trace.', SUB_TRACES
	NUMBER(18,0)
	COMMENT 'The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.', TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.', TRACE_INDEX
	NUMBER(19,0)
	COMMENT 'The index of the trace within the transaction.', TRACE_STATUS
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.', TX_STATUS
	VARCHAR(7)
	COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.', TYPE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.', VALUE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.', VALUE_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.', VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.'
)
fact_traces.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRACES(
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.',
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number of this transaction.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp of this transaction.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.',
	VALUE COMMENT 'The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.',
	VALUE_PRECISE_RAW COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	VALUE_PRECISE COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	GAS COMMENT 'The gas supplied for this trace.',
	GAS_USED COMMENT 'The gas used for this trace.',
	INPUT COMMENT 'The input data for this trace.',
	OUTPUT COMMENT 'The output data for this trace.',
	TYPE COMMENT 'The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.',
	IDENTIFIER COMMENT 'This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.',
	DATA COMMENT 'The raw JSON data for this trace.',
	TX_STATUS COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.',
	SUB_TRACES COMMENT 'The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.',
	TRACE_STATUS COMMENT 'The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`',
	ERROR_REASON COMMENT 'The reason for the trace failure, if any.',
	TRACE_INDEX COMMENT 'The index of the trace within the transaction.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TRACES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Ethereum blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `TO_NUMBER(<FIELD>, ''XXXXXXXXXXXX'')`, with the number of Xs being the max length of the encoded field. You must also remove the `0x` from your field to use the `TO_NUMBER()` function, if applicable.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    tx_hash,
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    from_address,
    to_address,
    eth_value AS VALUE,
    eth_value_precise_raw AS value_precise_raw,
    eth_value_precise AS value_precise,
    gas,
    gas_used,
    input,
    output,
    TYPE,
    identifier,
    DATA,
    tx_status,
    sub_traces,
    trace_status,
    error_reason,
    trace_index,
    COALESCE (
        traces_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(trace_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_traces_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.traces
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.4.9", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "e48101f6-fe84-44d9-bc1d-224f5bfe608f", "node_name": "core__fact_traces", "node_alias": "fact_traces", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/core/core__fact_traces.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "core", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.core__fact_traces", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": false, "which": "run", "node_refs": ["silver__traces"], "materialized": "view"} */;

CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_FUNCTION_SIGNATURES (
	BYTES_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The byte signature for this function.', DIM_FUNCTION_SIGNATURES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', ID
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The ID for this function or event signature.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', TEXT_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The human-readable format for this function or event.', _INVOCATION_ID
	VARCHAR(36)
)
dim_function_signatures.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_FUNCTION_SIGNATURES(
	TEXT_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The human-readable format for this function or event.',
	BYTES_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The byte signature for this function.',
	ID COMMENT 'The ID for this function or event signature.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.DIM_FUNCTION_SIGNATURES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	_INVOCATION_ID
) COMMENT='This table contains function signatures used to decode Ethereum call data into a human-readable format. For more details see (https://www.4byte.directory/).'
 as (
    

SELECT
    text_signature,
    bytes_signature,
    id,
    
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(id as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT)) AS dim_function_signatures_id,
    SYSDATE() AS inserted_timestamp,
    SYSDATE() AS modified_timestamp,
    '0f8476f3-d524-465a-9897-cc72e084d482' AS _invocation_id
FROM
    ethereum.silver.signatures_backfill
  )

ez_decoded_traces.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_DECODED_TRACES (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number of this transaction.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp of this transaction.', DECODED_INPUT_DATA
	VARIANT
	COMMENT 'Decoded input data for the trace.', DECODED_OUTPUT_DATA
	VARIANT

	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The reason for the trace failure, if any.', FACT_DECODED_TRACES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.', FROM_ADDRESS_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the address that initiated the trace, if the contract has a name() function.', FUNCTION_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the function called in the trace.', GAS
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The gas supplied for this trace.', GAS_USED
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The gas used for this trace.', IDENTIFIER

ez_decoded_traces.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_DECODED_TRACES(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number of this transaction.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp of this transaction.',
	TX_STATUS COMMENT 'Status of the transaction.',
	TX_POSITION COMMENT 'The position of the transaction within the block.',
	TRACE_INDEX COMMENT 'The index of the trace within the transaction.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.',
	FROM_ADDRESS_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the address that initiated the trace, if the contract has a name() function.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.',
	TO_ADDRESS_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the address that received the trace, if the contract has a name() function.',
	VALUE COMMENT 'The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.',
	VALUE_PRECISE_RAW COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	VALUE_PRECISE COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	GAS COMMENT 'The gas supplied for this trace.',
	GAS_USED COMMENT 'The gas used for this trace.',
	TYPE COMMENT 'The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.',
	IDENTIFIER COMMENT 'This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.',
	SUB_TRACES COMMENT 'The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.',
	ERROR_REASON COMMENT 'The reason for the trace failure, if any.',
	TRACE_STATUS COMMENT 'The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`',
	INPUT COMMENT 'The input data for this trace.',
	OUTPUT COMMENT 'The output data for this trace.',
	FUNCTION_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the function called in the trace.',
	DECODED_INPUT_DATA COMMENT 'Decoded input data for the trace.',
	DECODED_OUTPUT_DATA COMMENT 'Decoded output data for the trace.',
	FACT_DECODED_TRACES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This model contains decoded data for traces on the Ethereum blockchain. It will not contain all records, but only those for which we have a valid ABI. If you are interested in submitting a contract for decoding, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/).\n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    tx_hash,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_status,
    tx_position,
    trace_index,
    from_address,
    c0.name AS from_address_name,
    to_address,
    c1.name AS to_address_name,
    VALUE,
    value_precise_raw,
    value_precise,
    gas,
    gas_used,
    TYPE,
    identifier,
    sub_traces,
    error_reason,
    trace_status,
    input,
    output,
    decoded_data :function_name :: STRING AS function_name,
    decoded_data :decoded_input_data AS decoded_input_data,
    decoded_data :decoded_output_data AS decoded_output_data,
    decoded_traces_id AS fact_decoded_traces_id,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(t.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c0.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c1.inserted_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS inserted_timestamp,
    GREATEST(COALESCE(t.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c0.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01'), COALESCE(c1.modified_timestamp, '2000-01-01')) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.decoded_traces
    t
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver.contracts
    c0
    ON t.from_address = c0.address
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver.contracts
    c1
    ON t.to_address = c1.address
  )

ez_native_transfers.name: ez_native_transfers
ez_native_transfers.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS (
	AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'ETH value transferred.', AMOUNT_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.', AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.', AMOUNT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'ETH value transferred, in USD.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.', IDENTIFIER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.', TRACE_INDEX
	NUMBER(19,0)
	COMMENT 'The index of the trace within the transaction.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.', TX_POSITION
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The position of the transaction within the block.'
)
ez_native_transfers.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS(
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.',
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_POSITION COMMENT 'The position of the transaction within the block.',
	TRACE_INDEX COMMENT 'The index of the trace within the transaction.',
	IDENTIFIER COMMENT 'This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'ETH value transferred.',
	AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW COMMENT 'The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	AMOUNT_PRECISE COMMENT 'The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'ETH value transferred, in USD.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains all native ETH transfers, including equivalent USD amounts. The origin addresses correspond to the to and from addresses from the `fact_transactions` table. The `identifier` and `tx_hash` columns relate this table back to `fact_traces`, which contains more details on the transfers.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    tx_hash,
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_position,
    trace_index,
    identifier,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    from_address,
    to_address,
    amount,
    amount_precise_raw,
    amount_precise,
    amount_usd,
    COALESCE (
        native_transfers_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(trace_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_native_transfers_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.native_transfers
  )

fact_eth_balances.name: fact_eth_balances
fact_eth_balances.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_ETH_BALANCES (
	BALANCE
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The unadjusted ETH balance.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Block number at which the ETH balance was read.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'Timestamp of block number read.', FACT_ETH_BALANCES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', USER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Wallet / contract address holding ETH.'
)
fact_eth_balances.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_ETH_BALANCES(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Block number at which the ETH balance was read.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Timestamp of block number read.',
	USER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'Wallet / contract address holding ETH.',
	BALANCE COMMENT 'The unadjusted ETH balance.',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_ETH_BALANCES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='BALANCES')
 COMMENT='''This table contains the unadjusted Ether (ETH) balances for users on the Ethereum blockchain.  When an ETH transfer occurs, we will read the balance of the involved parties at the transfer block.''\n'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    address AS user_address,
    balance,
    COALESCE (
        eth_balances_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_eth_balances_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.eth_balances
  )

CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Contract address of the token being transferred.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', RAW_AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.', RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred returned as a string to preserve precision. This value is not decimal adjusted.', TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.', _LOG_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''
)
fact_token_transfers.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'Contract address of the token being transferred.',
	FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of this transfer.',
	TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.',
	RAW_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.',
	RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE COMMENT 'The amount of tokens transferred returned as a string to preserve precision. This value is not decimal adjusted.',
	_LOG_ID COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	ETHEREUM.CORE.FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) COMMENT='This table contains events on the Ethereum Blockchain with an event name of ''Transfer''. The contract address is the token transferred, and the raw amount field is the amount of tokens transferred. Please note this amount is not decimal adjusted. Decimal adjustments for a token address can be found in ```dim_contracts```. This table will not contain transfers of native ETH.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    contract_address,
    from_address,
    to_address,
    raw_amount,
    raw_amount_precise,
    _log_id,
    COALESCE (
        transfers_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS fact_token_transfers_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.transfers
  )

	AMOUNT
	FLOAT

	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.', DEPOSITOR
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Its the address of the user who is Borrowing or repaying the loan, depending on the action.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_NAME
	VARCHAR(18)
	COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.', EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.', PLATFORM
	VARCHAR(11)
	COMMENT 'The specific protocol where lending event occurred.', PROTOCOL_MARKET
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.', TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the token associated with the lending action.', TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.'
)
ez_lending_withdraws.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The specific protocol where lending event occurred.',
	DEPOSITOR COMMENT 'Its the address of the user who is Borrowing or repaying the loan, depending on the action.',
	PROTOCOL_MARKET COMMENT 'The protocol''s specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.',
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the token associated with the lending action.',
	TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.',
	AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, UWU', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='LENDING, WITHDRAWS')
 COMMENT='This table contains transactions in which a user withdraws liquidity across the AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols. Users need to make sure there is enough liquidity (not borrowed) in order to withdraw, if this is not the case, users need to wait for more liquidity from depositors or borrowers repaying.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    contract_address,
    event_name,
    event_index,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    platform,
    depositor,
    protocol_market,
    token_address,
    token_symbol,
    amount_unadj,
    amount, 
    amount_usd,
    complete_lending_withdraws_id AS ez_lending_withdraws_id,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp
FROM 
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_lending_withdraws
  )

	VARCHAR(16777216)

)
ez_lending_liquidations.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The specific protocol where lending event occurred.',
	LIQUIDATOR COMMENT 'The address that initiated the liquidation call.',
	BORROWER COMMENT 'Address that initiated the borrow event.',
	PROTOCOL_MARKET COMMENT 'The protocol''s specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.',
	COLLATERAL_TOKEN COMMENT 'The asset provided as collateral, which can be liquidated.',
	COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.',
	AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.',
	DEBT_TOKEN COMMENT 'The debt asset, which the user borrowed.',
	DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS_ID,
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, UWU', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='LENDING, LIQUIDATIONS')
 COMMENT='This table contains transactions in which a borrower''s collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower''s health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower''s debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one''s debt is repaid.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    contract_address,
    event_name,
    event_index,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    platform,
    liquidator,
    borrower,
    protocol_market,
    collateral_token,
    collateral_token_symbol,
    amount_unadj,
    amount,
    amount_usd,
    debt_token,
    debt_token_symbol,
    complete_lending_liquidations_id AS ez_lending_liquidations_id,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp
FROM 
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_lending_liquidations
  )

ez_liquid_staking_deposits.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LIQUID_STAKING_DEPOSITS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract that received or processed the deposit/stake/mint.',
	STAKER COMMENT 'The address that performed the deposit/stake/mint action and received tokens in return, typically an EOA.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The platform that received or processed the deposit/stake/mint.',
	TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the liquid staking token.',
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the liquid staking token.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens, non-decimal adjusted.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens, decimal adjusted.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens in USD, where available.',
	ETH_AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The amount of ETH, non-decimal adjusted.',
	ETH_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of ETH, decimal adjusted.',
	ETH_AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The amount of ETH in USD, where available.',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LIQUID_STAKING_DEPOSITS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='ANKR, BINANCE, COINBASE, CREAM, FRAX, HORD, LIDO, NODEDAO, ROCKETPOOL, SHAREDSTAKE, STADER, STAFI, STAKEHOUND, STAKEWISE, SWELL, UNIETH', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='LIQUID STAKING, LSD')
 COMMENT='This table currently contains liquid staking derivative deposit/stake/mint events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table with the following protocols - ANKR, BINANCE, COINBASE, CREAM, FRAX, GUARDED, HORD, LIDO, NODEDAO, ROCKETPOOL, SHAREDSTAKE, STADER, STAFI, STAKEHOUND, STAKEWISE, SWELL, UNIETH - along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes deposit/stake/mint events for protocols with live, onchain liquid staking derivative token event logs, does not directly include staking from node operators, and may not represent the complete staking picture in accordance to the Ethereum Beacon Chain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    event_name,
    contract_address,
    recipient AS staker,
    platform,
    token_symbol,
    token_address,
    token_amount_unadj,
    token_amount_adj AS token_amount,
    ROUND(
        token_amount_usd,
        2
    ) AS token_amount_usd,
    eth_amount_unadj,
    eth_amount_adj AS eth_amount,
    ROUND(
        eth_amount_usd,
        2
    ) AS eth_amount_usd,
    COALESCE (
        complete_lsd_deposits_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_liquid_staking_deposits_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_lsd.complete_lsd_deposits
  )

ez_dex_swaps.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_DEX_SWAPS (
	AMOUNT_IN
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens put into the swap.', AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.', AMOUNT_IN_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.', AMOUNT_OUT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.', AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.', AMOUNT_OUT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', CONTRACT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_NAME
	VARCHAR(23)
	COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.', EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216), PLATFORM
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.', POOL_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216), SENDER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The Router is the Sender in the swap function.', SYMBOL_IN
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token sent for swap.', SYMBOL_OUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token being swapped to.', TOKEN_IN
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the token sent for swap.', TOKEN_OUT
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the token being swapped to.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.', TX_TO
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.', _LOG_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''
)
ez_dex_swaps.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_DEX_SWAPS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS,
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address interacted with for a given event.',
	POOL_NAME,
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.',
	AMOUNT_IN COMMENT 'The amount of tokens put into the swap.',
	AMOUNT_IN_USD COMMENT 'The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.',
	AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.',
	AMOUNT_OUT COMMENT 'The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.',
	AMOUNT_OUT_USD COMMENT 'The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.',
	SENDER COMMENT 'The Router is the Sender in the swap function.',
	TX_TO COMMENT 'The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the \"to\" field in the swap function.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.',
	TOKEN_IN COMMENT 'The address of the token sent for swap.',
	TOKEN_OUT COMMENT 'The address of the token being swapped to.',
	SYMBOL_IN COMMENT 'The symbol of the token sent for swap.',
	SYMBOL_OUT COMMENT 'The symbol of the token being swapped to.',
	_LOG_ID COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='SUSHI, UNISWAP, CURVE, SYNTHETIX, BALANCER, DODO, FRAX, HASHFLOW, KYBERSWAP, MAVERICK, PANCAKESWAP, SHIBASWAP, TRADER JOE, VERSE', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='DEX, SWAPS')
 COMMENT='This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for SUSHI, UNISWAP, CURVE, SYNTHETIX, BALANCER, DODO, FRAX, HASHFLOW, KYBERSWAP, MAVERICK, PANCAKESWAP, SHIBASWAP, TRADER JOE, AND VERSE along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! \nNote: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    origin_function_signature,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    contract_address,
    pool_name,
    event_name,
    amount_in_unadj,
    amount_in,
    ROUND(
        CASE
            WHEN amount_out_usd IS NULL
            OR ABS((amount_in_usd - amount_out_usd) / NULLIF(amount_out_usd, 0)) > 0.75
            OR ABS((amount_in_usd - amount_out_usd) / NULLIF(amount_in_usd, 0)) > 0.75 THEN NULL
            ELSE amount_in_usd
        END,
        2
    ) AS amount_in_usd,
    amount_out_unadj,
    amount_out,
    ROUND(
        CASE
            WHEN amount_in_usd IS NULL
            OR ABS((amount_out_usd - amount_in_usd) / NULLIF(amount_in_usd, 0)) > 0.75
            OR ABS((amount_out_usd - amount_in_usd) / NULLIF(amount_out_usd, 0)) > 0.75 THEN NULL
            ELSE amount_out_usd
        END,
        2
    ) AS amount_out_usd,
    sender,
    tx_to,
    event_index,
    platform,
    token_in,
    token_out,
    symbol_in,
    symbol_out,
    _log_id,
    COALESCE (
        complete_dex_swaps_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_dex_swaps_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_dex.complete_dex_swaps
  )

ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LIQUID_STAKING_WITHDRAWALS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address at the transaction level.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	CONTRACT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract that received or processed the withdraw/unstake/redeem/burn.',
	STAKER COMMENT 'The address that performed the withdraw/unstake/redeem/burn action and received ETH in return, typically an EOA.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The platform that received or processed the withdraw/unstake/redeem/burn.',
	TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the liquid staking token.',
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the liquid staking token.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens, non-decimal adjusted.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens, decimal adjusted.',
	TOKEN_AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The amount of liquid staking tokens in USD, where available.',
	ETH_AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The amount of ETH, non-decimal adjusted.',
	ETH_AMOUNT COMMENT 'The amount of ETH, decimal adjusted.',
	ETH_AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The amount of ETH in USD, where available.',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_LIQUID_STAKING_WITHDRAWALS_ID,
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='ANKR, COINBASE, CREAM, FRAX, LIDO, NODEDAO, ROCKETPOOL, SHAREDSTAKE, STADER, STAFI, UNIETH', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='LIQUID STAKING, LSD')
 COMMENT='This table currently contains liquid staking derivative withdraw/unstake/redeem/burn events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table with the following protocols - ANKR, COINBASE, CREAM, FRAX, LIDO, NODEDAO, ROCKETPOOL, SHAREDSTAKE, STADER, STAFI, UNIETH - along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes withdraw/unstake/redeem/burn events for protocols with live, onchain liquid staking derivative token event logs, does not directly include staking from node operators, and may not represent the complete staking picture in accordance to the Ethereum Beacon Chain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
  block_number,
  block_timestamp,
  origin_function_signature,
  origin_from_address,
  origin_to_address,
  tx_hash,
  event_index,
  event_name,
  contract_address,
  recipient AS staker,
  platform,
  token_symbol,
  token_address,
  token_amount_unadj,
  token_amount_adj AS token_amount,
  ROUND(
        token_amount_usd,
        2
    ) AS token_amount_usd,
    eth_amount_unadj,
    eth_amount_adj AS eth_amount,
    ROUND(
        eth_amount_usd,
        2
    ) AS eth_amount_usd,
  COALESCE (
    complete_lsd_withdrawals_id,
    
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
  ) AS ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals_id,
  COALESCE(
    inserted_timestamp,
    '2000-01-01'
  ) AS inserted_timestamp,
  COALESCE(
    modified_timestamp,
    '2000-01-01'
  ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
  ETHEREUM.silver_lsd.complete_lsd_withdrawals
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.7.15", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "386c944e-56d2-495c-a5da-d667bff15e4c", "node_name": "defi__ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals", "node_alias": "ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/defi/defi__ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "defi", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.defi__ez_liquid_staking_withdrawals", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PROTOCOL": "ANKR, COINBASE, CREAM, FRAX, LIDO, NODEDAO, ROCKETPOOL, SHAREDSTAKE, STADER, STAFI, UNIETH", "PURPOSE": "LIQUID STAKING, LSD"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": false, "which": "run", "invocation_command": "dbt run -m models/gold/defi", "node_refs": ["silver_lsd__complete_lsd_withdrawals"], "materialized": "view"} */;

ez_bridge_activity.name: ez_bridge_activity
ez_bridge_activity.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY (
	AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.', AMOUNT_UNADJ
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.', AMOUNT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.', BRIDGE_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.', DESTINATION_CHAIN
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.', DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.', DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.', EVENT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.', EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.', PLATFORM
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.', RECEIVER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.', SENDER
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.', TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.', TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.'
)
ez_bridge_activity.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The date and time at which the block was produced.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address at the transaction level.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'Event number within a transaction.',
	BRIDGE_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.',
	EVENT_NAME COMMENT 'The decoded event name for a given event.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.',
	SENDER COMMENT 'The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.',
	RECEIVER COMMENT 'The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.',
	DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER COMMENT 'The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.',
	DESTINATION_CHAIN COMMENT 'The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.',
	DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID COMMENT 'The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.',
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.',
	TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.',
	AMOUNT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='ACROSS, ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, NATIVE, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='BRIDGE')
 COMMENT='A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, NATIVE, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    bridge_address,
    event_name,
    platform,
    sender,
    receiver,
    destination_chain_receiver,
    COALESCE(
        standard_destination_chain,
        b.destination_chain
    ) AS destination_chain,
    destination_chain_id,
    token_address,
    token_symbol,
    amount_unadj,
    amount,
    ROUND(
        CASE
            WHEN amount_usd < 1e+15 THEN amount_usd
            ELSE NULL
        END,
        2
    ) AS amount_usd,
    COALESCE (
        complete_bridge_activity_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(_id as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_bridge_activity_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_bridge.complete_bridge_activity
    b
    LEFT JOIN ETHEREUM.silver_bridge.standard_dst_chain_seed C
    ON b.destination_chain = C.destination_chain
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.7.15", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "386c944e-56d2-495c-a5da-d667bff15e4c", "node_name": "defi__ez_bridge_activity", "node_alias": "ez_bridge_activity", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/defi/defi__ez_bridge_activity.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "defi", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.defi__ez_bridge_activity", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PROTOCOL": "ACROSS, ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, NATIVE, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE", "PURPOSE": "BRIDGE"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": false, "which": "run", "invocation_command": "dbt run -m models/gold/defi", "node_refs": ["silver_bridge__complete_bridge_activity", "silver_bridge__standard_dst_chain_seed"], "materialized": "view"} */;

dim_dex_liquidity_pools.name: dim_dex_liquidity_pools
dim_dex_liquidity_pools.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.DEFI.DIM_DEX_LIQUIDITY_POOLS (
	CREATION_BLOCK
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number of when this pool was created.', CREATION_TIME
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp of when this pool was created.', CREATION_TX
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction where this contract was created.', DECIMALS
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The # of decimals for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0_decimal = 6
;', DIM_DEX_LIQUIDITY_POOLS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', FACTORY_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that created or deployed this pool, where available.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', PLATFORM
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.', POOL_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address for the liquidity pool.', POOL_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the liquidity pool, where available. In some cases, the pool name is a concatenation of symbols or token addresses.', SYMBOLS
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The symbol for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0_symbol = 'WETH'
;', TOKENS
	OBJECT
	COMMENT 'The address for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0 = '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2'
;'
)
dim_dex_liquidity_pools.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.DEFI.DIM_DEX_LIQUIDITY_POOLS(
	CREATION_BLOCK COMMENT 'The block number of when this pool was created.',
	CREATION_TIME COMMENT 'The block timestamp of when this pool was created.',
	CREATION_TX COMMENT 'The transaction where this contract was created.',
	PLATFORM COMMENT 'The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.',
	FACTORY_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that created or deployed this pool, where available.',
	POOL_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address for the liquidity pool.',
	POOL_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the liquidity pool, where available. In some cases, the pool name is a concatenation of symbols or token addresses.',
	TOKENS COMMENT 'The address for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object. \n\nQuery example to access the key:value pairing within the object:\nSELECT\n    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,\n    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,\n    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,\n    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal\nFROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools\nWHERE token0 = ''0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2''\n;',
	SYMBOLS COMMENT 'The symbol for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. \n\nQuery example to access the key:value pairing within the object:\nSELECT\n    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,\n    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,\n    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,\n    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal\nFROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools\nWHERE token0_symbol = ''WETH''\n;',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The # of decimals for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. \n\nQuery example to access the key:value pairing within the object:\nSELECT\n    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,\n    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,\n    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,\n    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal\nFROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools\nWHERE token0_decimal = 6\n;',
	ETHEREUM.DEFI.DIM_DEX_LIQUIDITY_POOLS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PROTOCOL='BALANCER, CURVE, DODO, FRAXSWAP, KYBERSWAP, MAVERICK, PANCAKESWAP, SHIBASWAP, SUSHISWAP, UNISWAP, TRADER JOE, VERSE', ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='DEX, LIQUIDITY, POOLS, LP, SWAPS')
 COMMENT='This table contains details on decentralized exchange (DEX) liquidity pools (LP) on the Ethereum blockchain, including the tokens, symbols and decimals within each pool alongside the following protocols: BALANCER, CURVE, DODO, FRAXSWAP, KYBERSWAP, MAVERICK, PANCAKESWAP, SHIBASWAP, SUSHISWAP, UNISWAP, TRADER JOE, VERSE .'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number AS creation_block,
    block_timestamp AS creation_time,
    tx_hash AS creation_tx,
    platform,
    contract_address AS factory_address,
    pool_address,
    pool_name,
    tokens,
    symbols,
    decimals,
    COALESCE (
        complete_dex_liquidity_pools_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(pool_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS dim_dex_liquidity_pools_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_dex.complete_dex_liquidity_pools
  )
