dim_dex_liquidity_pools.select_information_schema_columns_stmt: SELECT * FROM ETHEREUM.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_SCHEMA = 'DEFI' AND TABLE_NAME = 'DIM_DEX_LIQUIDITY_POOLS'
information_schema_columns_values:
The symbol for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0_symbol = 'WETH'
;
The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

The address for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0 = '0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2'
;
The block timestamp of when this pool was created.
The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.
The contract address for the liquidity pool.

The # of decimals for the token included in the liquidity pool, as a JSON object, where available. 

Query example to access the key:value pairing within the object:
SELECT
    DISTINCT pool_address AS unique_pools,
    tokens :token0 :: STRING AS token0,
    symbols: token0 :: STRING AS token0_symbol,
    decimals: token0 :: STRING AS token0_decimal
FROM ethereum.defi.dim_dex_liquidity_pools
WHERE token0_decimal = 6
;
The block number of when this pool was created.
The transaction where this contract was created.
The address that created or deployed this pool, where available.
The name of the liquidity pool, where available. In some cases, the pool name is a concatenation of symbols or token addresses.
The unique identifier for each row in the table.
The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

ez_nft_mints.name: ez_nft_mints
ez_nft_mints.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_MINTS (
	AMOUNT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The total amount, specified by the mint token address, used as payment to mint the specified number of NFTs corresponding to this token id.', AMOUNT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The USD value of 'amount'.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.', ERC1155_VALUE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.', EVENT_TYPE
	VARCHAR(8)
	COMMENT 'The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.', EZ_NFT_MINTS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MINT_PRICE_ETH
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The price paid in ETH to mint the NFT(s).', MINT_PRICE_TOKENS
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens supplied within the same transaction to mint the NFT. This field may not handle all edge cases.', MINT_PRICE_TOKENS_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of tokens supplied in US dollars within the same transaction to mint the NFT. This field may not handle all edge cases.', MINT_PRICE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The price paid in US dollars to mint the NFT(s).', MINT_TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the token supplied to mint the NFT, if applicable. This field may not handle all edge cases.', MINT_TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the token supplied to mint the NFT, if applicable. This field may not handle all edge cases.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NFT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the NFT.', NFT_COUNT
	NUMBER(18,0)
	COMMENT 'The number of NFTs minted in this event.', NFT_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The sending address of the NFT in the transaction.', NFT_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The receiving address of the NFT in the transaction.', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.', TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.', _INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.'', _LOG_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''
)
ez_nft_mints.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_MINTS(
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.',
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.',
	EVENT_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.',
	NFT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the NFT.',
	PROJECT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.',
	NFT_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of the NFT in the transaction.',
	NFT_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of the NFT in the transaction.',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.',
	ERC1155_VALUE COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.',
	MINT_PRICE_ETH COMMENT 'The price paid in ETH to mint the NFT(s).',
	MINT_PRICE_USD COMMENT 'The price paid in US dollars to mint the NFT(s).',
	NFT_COUNT COMMENT 'The number of NFTs minted in this event.',
	AMOUNT COMMENT 'The total amount, specified by the mint token address, used as payment to mint the specified number of NFTs corresponding to this token id.',
	AMOUNT_USD COMMENT 'The USD value of ''amount''.',
	MINT_PRICE_TOKENS COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of tokens supplied within the same transaction to mint the NFT. This field may not handle all edge cases.',
	MINT_PRICE_TOKENS_USD COMMENT 'The amount of tokens supplied in US dollars within the same transaction to mint the NFT. This field may not handle all edge cases.',
	MINT_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the token supplied to mint the NFT, if applicable. This field may not handle all edge cases.',
	MINT_TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the token supplied to mint the NFT, if applicable. This field may not handle all edge cases.',
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.',
	_LOG_ID COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	_INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.''',
	ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_MINTS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains NFT mint events on the Ethereum blockchain. Only the Ethereum database would have this NFT mint table. To get NFT mint transactions on other EVM chains, you can still use the NFT transfer table and filter for ''mint'' in the event_type column. In this table, we recognize that columns involving mint price, e.g. mint_price_eth and amount might not reflect the actual amount paid for the NFT mint'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_timestamp,
    block_number,
    tx_hash,
    event_type,
    nft_address,
    project_name,
    nft_from_address,
    nft_to_address,
    tokenId,
    erc1155_value,
    mint_price_eth,
    mint_price_usd,
    nft_count,
    amount,
    amount_usd,
    mint_price_tokens,
    mint_price_tokens_usd,
    mint_token_symbol,
    mint_token_address,
    tx_fee,
    _log_id,
    _inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE (
        nft_mints_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(_log_id as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(nft_address as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_mints_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.nft_mints
  )

ez_lending_liquidations.name: ez_lending_liquidations
ez_lending_liquidations.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS (
	APR
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.', BORROWER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction', EZ_NFT_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', INTEREST_RATE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated', LENDER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that gives out a loan to the borrower. In the case of NFTFI, when a loan is issued, a promissory note (an ERC721) is issued to the lender. The lender can transfer this note to any address which makes any receiving address the new "lender"', LOANID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The ID associated with the loan, often times tied to the borrower's address and collateral. For the case of Blur's blend, this ID can be used as a unique identifier when tracking active loans. However, note that refinances can happen while still maintaining the same loanId. For platforms like NFTFI, loanids of previously paid loans are reused hence they can't be reliably used as a unique identifier without appropriate timestamp filters. Instead, use the unique_loan_id column.', LOAN_DUE_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null', LOAN_START_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted', LOAN_TERM_TYPE
	VARCHAR(9)
	COMMENT 'The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.', LOAN_TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur's ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC', LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NFT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.', PLATFORM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the platform's lending contract', PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION
	VARCHAR(8)
	COMMENT 'The version of the platform's lending contract', PLATFORM_NAME
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'The name of the platform', PRINCIPAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216), TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.', TX_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.', UNIQUE_LOAN_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For the same loan, the value of this ID will remain the same across the loans taken, liquidations and repayment tables. For some platforms like NFTFI where the lender is issued a promissory note, the lender can send this note to any address, making the receiver the new lender. However, the unique_loan_id still remains the same although the final lender is different. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.'
)
ez_lending_liquidations.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction',
	PLATFORM_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the platform',
	PLATFORM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the platform''s lending contract',
	PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION COMMENT 'The version of the platform''s lending contract',
	LOANID COMMENT 'The ID associated with the loan, often times tied to the borrower''s address and collateral. For the case of Blur''s blend, this ID can be used as a unique identifier when tracking active loans. However, note that refinances can happen while still maintaining the same loanId. For platforms like NFTFI, loanids of previously paid loans are reused hence they can''t be reliably used as a unique identifier without appropriate timestamp filters. Instead, use the unique_loan_id column.',
	UNIQUE_LOAN_ID COMMENT 'The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For the same loan, the value of this ID will remain the same across the loans taken, liquidations and repayment tables. For some platforms like NFTFI where the lender is issued a promissory note, the lender can send this note to any address, making the receiver the new lender. However, the unique_loan_id still remains the same although the final lender is different. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.',
	LENDER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that gives out a loan to the borrower. In the case of NFTFI, when a loan is issued, a promissory note (an ERC721) is issued to the lender. The lender can transfer this note to any address which makes any receiving address the new \"lender\"',
	BORROWER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral',
	PROJECT_NAME,
	NFT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral',
	LOAN_TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur''s ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC',
	LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH',
	PRINCIPAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL_USD COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms',
	INTEREST_RATE COMMENT 'The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated',
	APR COMMENT 'The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).',
	LOAN_TERM_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.',
	LOAN_START_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted',
	LOAN_DUE_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null',
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.',
	TX_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	EZ_NFT_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains liquidation events for loans backed by collateralized NFTs on Ethereum. This typically means the lender of the loan closes the loan and receives the NFT collateral'
 as (
    

SELECT 
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    platform_name,
    platform_address,
    platform_exchange_version,
    loanId,
    unique_loan_id,
    lender_address,
    borrower_address,
    project_name,
    nft_address,
    tokenId,
    loan_token_address,
    loan_token_symbol,
    principal_unadj,
    principal,
    principal_usd,
    interest_rate,
    apr,
    loan_term_type,
    loan_start_timestamp,
    loan_due_timestamp,
    tx_fee,
    tx_fee_usd,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    COALESCE (
        nft_lending_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_name as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_exchange_version as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_lending_liquidations_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp

FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_nft.complete_liquidations
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.7.8", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "cd2ff737-e7ec-45d8-a5ba-224b95487c61", "node_name": "nft__ez_lending_liquidations", "node_alias": "ez_lending_liquidations", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_liquidations.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "nft", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.nft__ez_lending_liquidations", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PURPOSE": "NFT"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": true, "which": "run", "invocation_command": "dbt run -m models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_loans.sql models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_repayments.sql models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_liquidations.sql --full-refresh", "node_refs": ["silver_nft__complete_liquidations"], "materialized": "view"} */;

information_schema_columns_values: The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.
The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH
The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.
The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.
The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral
The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral
The version of the platform's lending contract
The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur's ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC
The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null
The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).

The address that gives out a loan to the borrower. In the case of NFTFI, when a loan is issued, a promissory note (an ERC721) is issued to the lender. The lender can transfer this note to any address which makes any receiving address the new "lender"

The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For the same loan, the value of this ID will remain the same across the loans taken, liquidations and repayment tables. For some platforms like NFTFI where the lender is issued a promissory note, the lender can send this note to any address, making the receiver the new lender. However, the unique_loan_id still remains the same although the final lender is different. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.
The function signature of this transaction.
The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places

The ID associated with the loan, often times tied to the borrower's address and collateral. For the case of Blur's blend, this ID can be used as a unique identifier when tracking active loans. However, note that refinances can happen while still maintaining the same loanId. For platforms like NFTFI, loanids of previously paid loans are reused hence they can't be reliably used as a unique identifier without appropriate timestamp filters. Instead, use the unique_loan_id column.
The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted
The contract address of the platform's lending contract
The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places
The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.
The event number within a transaction
The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.

The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated
The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.
The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.
The block number at which the NFT event occurred.
The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.
The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms
The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.
The address of the NFT used as collateral
The unique identifier for each row in the table.

	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP

	COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral', DEBT

	COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with adjusted decimal places', DEBT_UNADJ

	COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with unadjusted decimal places', DEBT_USD

	COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction', EVENT_TYPE

'repay' events are full repayment events by the borrower to get their collateral back while 'refinance' events represent the same borrower engaging a new lender and repay their past loan. The collateral is still locked in this scenario.', EZ_NFT_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', INTEREST_RATE

For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated', LENDER_ADDRESS

	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null', LOAN_PAID_TIMESTAMP

	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted', LOAN_TERM_TYPE

	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur's ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC', LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NFT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.', PLATFORM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the platform's lending contract', PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION

	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with adjusted decimal places', PLATFORM_FEE_UNADJ

	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with unadjusted decimal places', PLATFORM_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform in USD terms', PLATFORM_NAME
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'The name of the platform', PRINCIPAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216), TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.', TX_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.', UNIQUE_LOAN_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.'

ez_lending_repayments.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS(
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.',
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction',
	EVENT_TYPE COMMENT 'There are 2 types of loan repayment events. It can either be repay or refinance. ''repay'' events are full repayment events by the borrower to get their collateral back while ''refinance'' events represent the same borrower engaging a new lender and repay their past loan. The collateral is still locked in this scenario.',
	PLATFORM_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the platform',
	PLATFORM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the platform''s lending contract',
	PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION COMMENT 'The version of the platform''s lending contract',
	LOANID COMMENT 'The ID associated with the loan, often times tied to the borrower''s address and collateral. For the case of Blur''s blend, this ID can be used as a unique identifier when tracking active loans. However, note that refinances can happen while still maintaining the same loanId. For platforms like NFTFI, loanids of previously paid loans are reused hence they can''t be reliably used as a unique identifier without appropriate timestamp filters. Instead, use the unique_loan_id column.',
	UNIQUE_LOAN_ID COMMENT 'The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For the same loan, the value of this ID will remain the same across the loans taken, liquidations and repayment tables. For some platforms like NFTFI where the lender is issued a promissory note, the lender can send this note to any address, making the receiver the new lender. However, the unique_loan_id still remains the same although the final lender is different. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.',
	LENDER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that gives out a loan to the borrower. In the case of NFTFI, when a loan is issued, a promissory note (an ERC721) is issued to the lender. The lender can transfer this note to any address which makes any receiving address the new \"lender\"',
	BORROWER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral',
	PROJECT_NAME,
	NFT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral',
	LOAN_TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur''s ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC',
	LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH',
	PRINCIPAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL_USD COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms',
	DEBT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with unadjusted decimal places',
	DEBT COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with adjusted decimal places',
	DEBT_USD COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) in USD terms',
	PLATFORM_FEE_UNADJ COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with unadjusted decimal places',
	PLATFORM_FEE COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with adjusted decimal places',
	PLATFORM_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform in USD terms',
	INTEREST_RATE COMMENT 'The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated',
	APR COMMENT 'The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).',
	LOAN_TERM_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.',
	LOAN_START_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted',
	LOAN_DUE_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null',
	LOAN_PAID_TIMESTAMP,
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.',
	TX_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	EZ_NFT_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains repayment events for loans backed by collateralized NFTs on Ethereum. Events in this table can be a full repayment either by the borrower to get their collateral back or by a new lender to repay the borrower''s previous loan. The latter is labeled as ''refinance'' where the same borrower takes on a new loan from a new lender and repays the past loan. The NFT collateral is still locked in this scenario.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    event_type,
    platform_name,
    platform_address,
    platform_exchange_version,
    loanId,
    unique_loan_id,
    lender_address,
    borrower_address,
    project_name,
    nft_address,
    tokenId,
    loan_token_address,
    loan_token_symbol,
    principal_unadj,
    principal,
    principal_usd,
    debt_unadj,
    debt,
    debt_usd,
    platform_fee_unadj,
    platform_fee,
    platform_fee_usd,
    interest_rate,
    apr,
    loan_term_type,
    loan_start_timestamp,
    loan_due_timestamp,
    loan_paid_timestamp,
    tx_fee,
    tx_fee_usd,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    COALESCE (
        nft_lending_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_name as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_exchange_version as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_lending_repayments_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp

FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_nft.complete_repayments
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.2", "dbt_version": "1.7.8", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "cd2ff737-e7ec-45d8-a5ba-224b95487c61", "node_name": "nft__ez_lending_repayments", "node_alias": "ez_lending_repayments", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_repayments.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "nft", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.nft__ez_lending_repayments", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PURPOSE": "NFT"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": true, "which": "run", "invocation_command": "dbt run -m models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_loans.sql models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_repayments.sql models/gold/nft/lending/nft__ez_lending_liquidations.sql --full-refresh", "node_refs": ["silver_nft__complete_repayments"], "materialized": "view"} */;

ez_nft_sales.name: ez_nft_sales
ez_nft_sales.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_SALES (
	AGGREGATOR_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the aggregator platform where the sale took place. If the sale did not take place via an aggregator platform, then the value will be null.', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.', BUYER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the buyer of the NFT in the transaction.', CREATOR_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in the transaction's currency.', CREATOR_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in US dollars.', CURRENCY_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The token contract address for this NFT event. This will be `ETH` for native ETH transactions.', CURRENCY_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The token symbol for this NFT event.', ERC1155_VALUE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.', EVENT_INDEX
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction', EVENT_TYPE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.', EZ_NFT_SALES_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NFT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the NFT.', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.', PLATFORM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the exchange used for the transaction.', PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION
	VARCHAR(12)
	COMMENT 'The version of the exchange contract used for the transaction.', PLATFORM_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in the transaction's currency.', PLATFORM_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in US dollars.', PLATFORM_NAME
	VARCHAR(10)
	COMMENT 'The name of the exchange used for the trade.', PRICE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of the NFT event in the currency in which the transaction occurred, decimal adjusted where possible.', PRICE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The amount of the NFT event in US dollars. This will be 0 for tokens without a decimal adjustment or hourly price.', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.', SELLER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the seller of the NFT in the transaction.', TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.', TOTAL_FEES
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in the transaction currency. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.', TOTAL_FEES_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in US dollars. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.', TX_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.'
)

	PROJECT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.',
	ERC1155_VALUE COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.',
	CURRENCY_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The token symbol for this NFT event.',
	CURRENCY_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The token contract address for this NFT event. This will be `ETH` for native ETH transactions.',
	PRICE COMMENT 'The amount of the NFT event in the currency in which the transaction occurred, decimal adjusted where possible.',
	PRICE_USD COMMENT 'The amount of the NFT event in US dollars. This will be 0 for tokens without a decimal adjustment or hourly price.',
	TOTAL_FEES COMMENT 'The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in the transaction currency. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.',
	PLATFORM_FEE COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in the transaction''s currency.',
	CREATOR_FEE COMMENT 'The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in the transaction''s currency.',
	TOTAL_FEES_USD COMMENT 'The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in US dollars. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.',
	PLATFORM_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in US dollars.',
	CREATOR_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in US dollars.',
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.',
	TX_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_SALES_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains NFT sale events from Opensea (Wyvern & Seaport), Blur, Rarible, X2Y2, Looksrare, NFTx, Sudoswap, and Larvalabs (Cryptopunks)'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    event_type,
    platform_address,
    platform_name,
    platform_exchange_version,
    aggregator_name,
    seller_address,
    buyer_address,
    nft_address,
    project_name,
    erc1155_value,
    tokenId,
    currency_symbol,
    currency_address,
    price,
    price_usd,
    total_fees,
    platform_fee,
    creator_fee,
    total_fees_usd,
    platform_fee_usd,
    creator_fee_usd,
    tx_fee,
    tx_fee_usd,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    COALESCE (
        complete_nft_sales_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_name as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_exchange_version as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_sales_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_nft.complete_nft_sales
  )
/* {"app": "dbt", "dbt_snowflake_query_tags_version": "2.3.1", "dbt_version": "1.4.9", "project_name": "ethereum_models", "target_name": "prod", "target_database": "ETHEREUM", "target_schema": "SILVER", "invocation_id": "0ea7a986-4a1f-4a58-aa3a-efdb1031e56d", "node_name": "nft__ez_nft_sales", "node_alias": "ez_nft_sales", "node_package_name": "ethereum_models", "node_original_file_path": "models/gold/nft/nft__ez_nft_sales.sql", "node_database": "ETHEREUM", "node_schema": "nft", "node_id": "model.ethereum_models.nft__ez_nft_sales", "node_resource_type": "model", "node_meta": {"database_tags": {"table": {"PURPOSE": "NFT"}}}, "node_tags": [], "full_refresh": true, "which": "run", "node_refs": ["silver_nft__complete_nft_sales"], "materialized": "view"} */;

ez_lending_loans.name: ez_lending_loans
ez_lending_loans.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_LENDING_LOANS (
	APR
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).', BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.', BORROWER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral', DEBT
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with adjusted decimal places', DEBT_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with unadjusted decimal places', DEBT_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) in USD terms', EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction', EVENT_TYPE
	VARCHAR(9)
	COMMENT 'There are 2 types of loan creation events. It can either be a new loan or a refinance of an existing loan.', EZ_NFT_LENDING_LOANS_ID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', INTEREST_RATE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated', LENDER_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address that gives out a loan to the borrower. In the case of NFTFI, when a loan is issued, a promissory note (an ERC721) is issued to the lender. The lender can transfer this note to any address which makes any receiving address the new "lender"', LOANID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The ID associated with the loan, often times tied to the borrower's address and collateral. For the case of Blur's blend, this ID can be used as a unique identifier when tracking active loans. However, note that refinances can happen while still maintaining the same loanId. For platforms like NFTFI, loanids of previously paid loans are reused hence they can't be reliably used as a unique identifier without appropriate timestamp filters. Instead, use the unique_loan_id column.', LOAN_DUE_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null', LOAN_START_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted', LOAN_TENURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The tenure of the loan denominated in seconds. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null', LOAN_TERM_TYPE
	VARCHAR(9)
	COMMENT 'The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.', LOAN_TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur's ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC', LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NFT_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral', ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.', ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.', ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.', PLATFORM_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The contract address of the platform's lending contract', PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION
	VARCHAR(8)
	COMMENT 'The version of the platform's lending contract', PLATFORM_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with adjusted decimal places', PLATFORM_FEE_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with unadjusted decimal places', PLATFORM_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform in USD terms', PLATFORM_NAME
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'The name of the platform', PRINCIPAL
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_UNADJ
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places', PRINCIPAL_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216), TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral', TX_FEE
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.', TX_FEE_USD
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.', TX_HASH
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.', UNIQUE_LOAN_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique ID that can be used to represent a loan within the same platform. For the same loan, the value of this ID will remain the same across the loans taken, liquidations and repayment tables. For some platforms like NFTFI where the lender is issued a promissory note, the lender can send this note to any address, making the receiver the new lender. However, the unique_loan_id still remains the same although the final lender is different. For Blend, unique_loan_id changes only if the loanId and lender changes which would also indicate the previous loan has been fully paid off.'
)

	BORROWER_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address that receives the loan and has an NFT locked as collateral',
	PROJECT_NAME,
	NFT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The address of the NFT used as collateral',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The tokenId of the NFT used as collateral',
	LOAN_TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of what the loan is denominated in. For Blend, this is Blur''s ETH while for NFTFI this could be either WETH, DAI or USDC',
	LOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of the loan token address. For Blur Pool, the symbol is ETH',
	PRINCIPAL_UNADJ COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with unadjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken with adjusted decimal places',
	PRINCIPAL_USD COMMENT 'The principal amount of the loan taken in USD terms',
	DEBT_UNADJ COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with unadjusted decimal places',
	DEBT COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) with adjusted decimal places',
	DEBT_USD COMMENT 'The total debt of the loan (principal amount plus interests) in USD terms',
	PLATFORM_FEE_UNADJ COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with unadjusted decimal places',
	PLATFORM_FEE COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform with adjusted decimal places',
	PLATFORM_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The fee charged by the lending platform in USD terms',
	INTEREST_RATE COMMENT 'The non-annualized rate charged by the lender on the principal amount of the loan denominated in percentage (%). For fixed term loans, it is calculated by taking the difference between total debt and principal amount divided by principal amount. For perpetual term loans, interest rate is usually on an annual basis and total debt is calculated prorated',
	APR COMMENT 'The annualized interest rate denominated in percentage (%).',
	LOAN_TERM_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of loan terms, could be either a fixed loan or a perpetual loan. A fixed term loan as a fixed repayment date while a perpetual loan does not.',
	LOAN_START_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan offer is accepted',
	LOAN_DUE_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The timestamp of when the loan is due. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null',
	LOAN_TENURE COMMENT 'The tenure of the loan denominated in seconds. For perpetual term loan, the value will be null',
	TX_FEE COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.',
	TX_FEE_USD COMMENT 'The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.',
	ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The from address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the NFT buyer. However, for some more complex transactions, it may not be the NFT buyer.',
	ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The to address of this transaction. In most cases, this is the exchange contract. However, for some more complex NFT events, such as aggregate buys with tools such as Gem and Genie, this may not be the exchange address.',
	ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE COMMENT 'The function signature of this transaction.',
	EZ_NFT_LENDING_LOANS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains NFT lending events for loans backed by collateralized NFTs on Ethereum. For Blur''s Blend, this could be depositing an NFT and taking out a loan or using the Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) feature to take a loan out of the newly bought NFT. This NFT will remain locked until the loan is cleared.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_number,
    block_timestamp,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    event_type,
    platform_name,
    platform_address,
    platform_exchange_version,
    loanId,
    unique_loan_id,
    lender_address,
    borrower_address,
    project_name,
    nft_address,
    tokenId,
    loan_token_address,
    loan_token_symbol,
    principal_unadj,
    principal,
    principal_usd,
    debt_unadj,
    debt,
    debt_usd,
    platform_fee_unadj,
    platform_fee,
    platform_fee_usd,
    interest_rate,
    apr,
    loan_term_type,
    loan_start_timestamp,
    loan_due_timestamp,
    loan_tenure,
    tx_fee,
    tx_fee_usd,
    origin_from_address,
    origin_to_address,
    origin_function_signature,
    COALESCE (
        nft_lending_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(block_number as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_name as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(platform_exchange_version as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_lending_loans_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver_nft.complete_loans
  )

ez_nft_transfers.create_table_stmt:
CREATE TABLE ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_TRANSFERS (
	BLOCK_NUMBER
	NUMBER(38,0)
	COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.', BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.', ERC1155_VALUE
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.', EVENT_INDEX
	FLOAT
	COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction', EVENT_TYPE
	VARCHAR(5)
	COMMENT 'The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.', EZ_NFT_TRANSFERS_ID
	VARCHAR(32)
	COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.', INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', INTRA_EVENT_INDEX
	NUMBER(18,0)
	COMMENT 'The order of events within a single event index. This is primarily used for ERC1155 NFT batch transfer events.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP

	COMMENT 'The sending address of the NFT in the transaction.', NFT_TO_ADDRESS

	COMMENT 'The receiving address of the NFT in the transaction.', PROJECT_NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.', TOKENID
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.', TX_HASH

	COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.'

ez_nft_transfers.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_TRANSFERS(
	BLOCK_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.',
	BLOCK_NUMBER COMMENT 'The block number at which the NFT event occurred.',
	TX_HASH COMMENT 'The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.',
	EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'The event number within a transaction',
	INTRA_EVENT_INDEX COMMENT 'The order of events within a single event index. This is primarily used for ERC1155 NFT batch transfer events.',
	EVENT_TYPE COMMENT 'The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.',
	NFT_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The contract address of the NFT.',
	PROJECT_NAME COMMENT 'The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.',
	NFT_FROM_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The sending address of the NFT in the transaction.',
	NFT_TO_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The receiving address of the NFT in the transaction.',
	TOKENID COMMENT 'The token ID for this NFT contract.',
	ERC1155_VALUE COMMENT 'If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.',
	ETHEREUM.NFT.EZ_NFT_TRANSFERS_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.'
) WITH TAG (ETHEREUM.SILVER.PURPOSE='NFT')
 COMMENT='This table contains NFT transfer events on the Ethereum blockchain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    block_timestamp,
    block_number,
    tx_hash,
    event_index,
    intra_event_index,
    event_type,
    contract_address AS nft_address,
    project_name,
    from_address AS nft_from_address,
    to_address AS nft_to_address,
    tokenId,
    erc1155_value,
    COALESCE (
        nft_transfers_id,
        
    
md5(cast(coalesce(cast(tx_hash as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') || '-' || coalesce(cast(intra_event_index as TEXT), '_dbt_utils_surrogate_key_null_') as TEXT))
    ) AS ez_nft_transfers_id,
    COALESCE(
        inserted_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS inserted_timestamp,
    COALESCE(
        modified_timestamp,
        '2000-01-01'
    ) AS modified_timestamp
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.nft_transfers
  )

However, in the `ez_` views, it will be lowercase by default for all EVMs.'
)
dim_asset_metadata.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.PRICE.DIM_ASSET_METADATA(
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The specific address representing the asset on a specific platform. This will be NULL if referring to a native asset. The case (upper / lower) may or may not be specified within the `dim_asset_metadata` table, as this column is raw and not transformed, coming directly from the provider APIs. However, in the `ez_` views, it will be lowercase by default for all EVMs.',
	ASSET_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier representing the asset.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of asset.',
	NAME COMMENT 'The name of asset.',
	BLOCKCHAIN COMMENT 'The Blockchain, Network, or Platform for this asset.',
	BLOCKCHAIN_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier of the Blockchain, Network, or Platform for this asset.',
	PROVIDER COMMENT 'The provider or source of the data.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	ETHEREUM.PRICE.DIM_ASSET_METADATA_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.'
) COMMENT='A comprehensive dimensional table holding asset metadata and other relevant details pertaining to each id, from multiple providers. This data set includes raw, non-transformed data coming directly from the provider APIs and rows are not intended to be unique. As a result, there may be data quality issues persisting in the APIs that flow through to this dimensional model. If you are interested in using a curated data set instead, please utilize ez_asset_metadata.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    token_address,
    asset_id,
    symbol,
    name,
    platform AS blockchain,
    platform_id AS blockchain_id,
    provider,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp,
    complete_provider_asset_metadata_id AS dim_asset_metadata_id
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_provider_asset_metadata
  )

	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.', IS_DEPRECATED
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'A flag indicating if the asset is deprecated or no longer supported by the provider.', IS_NATIVE
	BOOLEAN
	COMMENT 'A flag indicating assets native to the respective blockchain.', MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
	TIMESTAMP_NTZ(9)
	COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.', NAME
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The name of asset.', SYMBOL
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The symbol of asset.', TOKEN_ADDRESS
	VARCHAR(16777216)
	COMMENT 'The specific address representing the asset on a specific platform. This will be NULL if referring to a native asset. The case (upper / lower) may or may not be specified within the `dim_asset_metadata` table, as this column is raw and not transformed, coming directly from the provider APIs. However, in the `ez_` views, it will be lowercase by default for all EVMs.'
)
ez_asset_metadata.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.PRICE.EZ_ASSET_METADATA(
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The specific address representing the asset on a specific platform. This will be NULL if referring to a native asset. The case (upper / lower) may or may not be specified within the `dim_asset_metadata` table, as this column is raw and not transformed, coming directly from the provider APIs. However, in the `ez_` views, it will be lowercase by default for all EVMs.',
	ASSET_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier representing the asset.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of asset.',
	NAME COMMENT 'The name of asset.',
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The number of decimals for the asset. May be NULL.',
	BLOCKCHAIN COMMENT 'The Blockchain, Network, or Platform for this asset.',
	IS_NATIVE COMMENT 'A flag indicating assets native to the respective blockchain.',
	IS_DEPRECATED COMMENT 'A flag indicating if the asset is deprecated or no longer supported by the provider.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	ETHEREUM.PRICE.EZ_ASSET_METADATA_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.'
) COMMENT='A convenience table holding prioritized asset metadata and other relevant details pertaining to each token_address and native asset. This data set is highly curated and contains metadata for one unique asset per blockchain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    token_address,
    asset_id,
    symbol,
    NAME,
    decimals,
    blockchain,
    FALSE AS is_native,
    is_deprecated,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp,
    complete_token_asset_metadata_id AS ez_asset_metadata_id
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_token_asset_metadata
UNION ALL
SELECT
    NULL AS token_address,
    asset_id,
    symbol,
    NAME,
    decimals,
    blockchain,
    TRUE AS is_native,
    is_deprecated,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp,
    complete_native_asset_metadata_id AS ez_asset_metadata_id
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_native_asset_metadata
  )

ez_prices_hourly.get_ddl_create_table:
create or replace view ETHEREUM.PRICE.EZ_PRICES_HOURLY(
	HOUR COMMENT 'Hour that the price was recorded at.',
	TOKEN_ADDRESS COMMENT 'The specific address representing the asset on a specific platform. This will be NULL if referring to a native asset. The case (upper / lower) may or may not be specified within the `dim_asset_metadata` table, as this column is raw and not transformed, coming directly from the provider APIs. However, in the `ez_` views, it will be lowercase by default for all EVMs.',
	SYMBOL COMMENT 'The symbol of asset.',
	NAME,
	DECIMALS COMMENT 'The number of decimals for the asset. May be NULL.',
	PRICE COMMENT 'Closing price of the recorded hour in USD.',
	BLOCKCHAIN COMMENT 'The Blockchain, Network, or Platform for this asset.',
	IS_NATIVE COMMENT 'A flag indicating assets native to the respective blockchain.',
	IS_IMPUTED COMMENT 'A flag indicating if the price was imputed, or derived, from the last arriving record. This is generally used for tokens with low-liquidity or inconsistent reporting.',
	IS_DEPRECATED COMMENT 'A flag indicating if the asset is deprecated or no longer supported by the provider.',
	INSERTED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.',
	MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP COMMENT 'The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.',
	ETHEREUM.PRICE.EZ_PRICES_HOURLY_ID COMMENT 'The unique identifier for each row in the table.'
) COMMENT='A convenience table for determining token prices by address and blockchain, and native asset prices by symbol and blockchain. This data set is highly curated and contains metadata for one price per hour per unique asset and blockchain.'
 as (
    

SELECT
    HOUR,
    token_address,
    symbol,
    NAME,
    decimals,
    price,
    blockchain,
    FALSE AS is_native,
    is_imputed,
    is_deprecated,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp,
    complete_token_prices_id AS ez_prices_hourly_id
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_token_prices
UNION ALL
SELECT
    HOUR,
    NULL AS token_address,
    symbol,
    NAME,
    decimals,
    price,
    blockchain,
    TRUE AS is_native,
    is_imputed,
    is_deprecated,
    inserted_timestamp,
    modified_timestamp,
    complete_native_prices_id AS ez_prices_hourly_id
FROM
    ETHEREUM.silver.complete_native_prices
  )
